Internship Description

WalletGyde is a forward-thinking, fast paced Startup company seeking to hire an intern with experience in Full Stack, coding and debugging. The intern will gain exciting real-world software engineering experience at a thriving company. If you’re interested in creating a user-friendly environment by writing code and moving forward in your career, then this job is for you. We expect you to be a tech-savvy individual, who is curious about new digital technologies and aspires to combine usability with visual design.

Ultimately, you should be able to create a functional and attractive digital environment for our company, ensuring great user experience.

Responsibilities

  • Developing front end website architecture.
  • Designing user interactions on web pages.
  • Developing back end website applications.
  • Creating servers and databases for functionality.
  • Ensuring cross-platform optimization for mobile phones.
  • Ensuring responsiveness of applications.
  • Working alongside graphic designers for web design features.
  • Seeing through a project from conception to finished product.
  • Designing and developing APIs.
  • Meeting both technical and consumer needs.
  • Staying abreast of developments in web applications and programming languages.

Requirements

  • C#
  • React
  • Azure DevOps
  • Azure CI/CD Pipelines
  • Azure SQL databases
  • Computer Science/Network Engineering, Engineering, or Mathematics major
  • Excellent analytical skills
  • Ability to work in teams
  • Self starter
  • Experience programming in React/Redux, JavaScript, CSS, HTML
  • SQL Server or similar database experience
  • Visual Studio
  • GitHub

Benefits

  • Practical experience with a wide variety of software engineering tasks
  • Shadowing, mentoring, and training opportunities with seasoned professionals
  • Opportunity to participate in networking events and company meetings
  • Flexible schedule for students
  • Compensation - This position will help students gain experience and build college credit, however compensation can be included down the line

About the Role:

As a security analyst intern at Pondurance you will work with other analysts to monitor, evaluate and report on clients network traffic in an effort to help mitigate their risk of attack, as well as immediately contain threats that do penetrate their defenses.

Responsibilities:


  • Monitor and analyze large amounts of network traffic looking for attacker presence
  • Identify threat vulnerabilities
  • Document and escalate incidents
  • Use cyber defense tools for continual monitoring and analysis of system activity to identify malicious activity
  • Provide weekly threat reports to clients
  • Conduct monthly vulnerability scans of clients networks

Qualifications:

  • Strong technical and analytical skills
  • Ideal candidate will hold a degree, or is pursuing a degree, in Computer Science, Cybersecurity, or a related technical discipline and/or will possess equivalent experience
  • Highly organized, able to multi-task, the ability to work individually, within a team, and with other groups

Company Details:


We started in early 2019 as a small group of technologists with a passion for making insurance better. Today we are working with a team of industry experts who run five different insurance brands and collectively control $1 billion in annual premiums.


We believe in an idea and execution meritocracy. In other words, a place where the best ideas win and the people who deliver the most value get the most opportunities.


As we grow our team, we are looking for inquisitive, entrepreneurial people who are excited to reimagine the insurance industry.


Insurance is too complex. Help us make it better.

Responsibilities:

The 10-week summer internship program provides emerging talent with hands-on experience with the commercial insurance industry, enabling you with skills to be successful going forward


Our software engineering teams leverage Agile development principles, advanced development and design practices, and an obsession over continuous deployment to deliver fast paced solutions. As a software development engineer intern, you'll support development of applications that are revolutionizing underwriting and claims. Your summer experience will enhance your business skills and you will be contributing directly to our goals and objectives.

Specific responsibilities will vary; your experience will include:

  • Delivering Results. You will obsess about taking initiatives to completion. We will ask you to constantly re-assess what we have built to make sure we are realizing actual value.
  • Continuous Learning. You will find ways to bring in new frameworks and tech into our stack. You help us find faster ways to accomplish tasks.
  • Challenging Status Quo. For various processes, we will expect you to understand what we do and why we do it. Then we will ask you to work across Business, Operations, Design, Data, and Engineering teams to reimagine how.
Qualifications:
  • Currently enrolled in a bachelor's degree program majoring in Computer Science or a related field with a graduation date of December 2021 or beyond
  • Excellent written and verbal communication
  • Exposure to algorithms, data structures and core computer science concepts
  • Experience with object-oriented development and design patterns
  • Proficiency in one or more programming languages such as Java, Javascript, Python, C++ etc.
  • Curiosity to learn and experiment.

What we’ll bring

  • An engaged and supportive leadership team that will invest in you
  • Talented engineering teams to build products with
  • A broad group of industry experts who work closely with us on everything we do
  • Networking and mentoring opportunities
  • Opportunity to learn and work with latest technologies

Position Summary

Samsung has been on the cutting-edge of innovation for decades. We believe that technology can, and should, make the world a better place, so we create new connections for people everywhere. Samsung’s 5G advancements will open up new possibilities that will continue to push us forward and bring new worlds within reach for our consumers. Our Networks interns take real-world connectivity problems and lead the charge on formulating creative solutions. Our structured program prepares every intern for success by allowing them to fully integrate into our dynamic culture while contributing their own unique ideas. We create opportunities for both undergraduate and graduate students to impact change and make the impossible possible. Join #LifeatSamsung.

Role and Responsibilities

Position Summary and Project Details:

This summer you will have the exciting opportunity to work on our Networks Engineering team. Our Summer Internship Program is designed to provide you an invaluable work experience as you take part in meaningful work and real-life projects within the organization.

Our global Networks business is expanding rapidly as we deploy complex technologies and innovative 4G/5G products at several of the world’s leading wireless operators. There is a lot of information out there, and our Engineering teams are continuously exploring new ways to meet customer requirements and standards.

If you thrive on analyzing complex problems, then this could be a great fit for you. One day you might be working on verifying the latest 5G features, and the next looking at 3GPP specifications to validate the messages in your network capture, all while you work on creating a regression test plan for the next software version that is going to be released. You will gain exposure to cross-functional teams across the organization and learn how these teams work in tandem to drive key business objectives.

Some of our available intern roles include:

  • Virtualization Engineer
  • System Test Engineer
  • RAN SME
  • DevOps Engineer
  • Performance Assurance Engineer
  • Engineering and Networks Support Engineer
  • Hardware Engineer

Skills and Qualifications

Qualifications:

  • Pursuing undergraduate, Master’s or PhD degree on a full-time basis at a 4-year college or university in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Data Science, Information technology management or related technical field.
  • Strong customer-focus coupled with excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal skills required
  • Continuous learner and problem solver with strong analytical skills
  • Passionate about technology
  • Self-starter with ability to perform duties in a very fast-paced environment
  • Strong ability to think creatively and demonstrate innovation
  • Ability to plan & prioritize multiple tasks efficiently and operate with a sense of urgency and attention to detail

Internship Eligibility:

  • Must be enrolled in an accredited University
  • Proper work authorization
  • Maintain a 3.0 or higher GPA
  • Attend New Hire Orientation on first day

SUMMER INTERN, IT SOFTWARE DEVELOPER

WHO WE ARE

DeMarche Associates, Inc. is a leading institutional financial research, investment consulting and investment management firm. Founded in 1974, DeMarche offers an array of services designed to help institutional trustees manage their organization’s endowments, pensions and private funds.

WHAT WE NEED

DeMarche is transitioning its proprietary legacy software from old code to new code. This presents an opportunity for an individual to acquire coding experience in a corporate environment while experiencing best practices in industry change management and testing protocols. The opportunity is an interim 9-week internship under the guidance and supervision of the firm’s lead programmer.

ABOUT THE INTERN OPPORTUNITY

This is a paid full-time internship that will run consecutively for 9 weeks beginning June 1, 2021 and concluding July 30, 2021. Compensation is $15 per hour, non-negotiable. All work is done between the core hours of 8:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. CT, Monday through Friday, in our Merriam corporate office located two blocks east of Interstate 35.

You must be a local candidate with residential accommodations in the Kansas City metro area. Preference is given to students nearing the end of their academic experience with declared majors in computer science from accredited colleges or technology programs. Consideration may be given to candidates with other business or technology degrees who have substantial work experience coding.

COVID safety practices are enforced in the office. This is not a remote position. Interns are not eligible for travel reimbursement, company benefits, housing, relocation or work sponsorship.

WHAT YOU WILL DO

  • Code and test programming for software.
  • Execute code builds to test in production environments.
  • Fix bugs in new code.
  • Maintain documentation according to coding best practices.

WHAT IS NEEDED FROM YOU FOR SUCCESS

Capabilities:

  • Ability to write clean, well-documented code and support documentation
  • Excellent complex problem solving skills
  • Solid troubleshooting and effective communication skills
  • Demonstrated analytical and critical thinking abilities
  • A track record of efficient, complete work with a sensitivity to timeliness
  • Meticulous attention to detail and editing
  • Demonstration of if/then logical, linear thinking
  • Ability for sustained, concentrated effort for high productivity and efficiency
  • Ability to follow directions accurately and to work with minimal daily supervision

Education and Experience Requirements:

  • Highly preferred:
  • Candidate is working toward an Associate’s degree or Bachelor’s degree in computer science or a related field
  • Required and necessary:
  • One or more years of coding experience
  • Strong experience with all languages: C#, REST, JAVA
  • Plus, hands-on experience with at least one: HTML5, CSS3, or JavaScript

HOW TO APPLY

Qualified applicants: Apply with a detailed resume. Initial screening interviews are conducted by telephone. Follow-up interviews with finalists are by invitation only and will occur virtually.

DeMarche is an Equal Opportunity Employer. To learn more about the firm, visit us at www.demarche.com.

No phone calls. No agencies. No third-party referrals.

Xerox Copy Solutions, Inc. is an authorized Platinum Sales Agent, Dealer, and reseller covering the greater Los Angeles area, representing the Xerox Corporation. Copy Solutions and Xerox are partnered together to offer the most advanced and leading edge digital technology for the office. We believe that no matter what size, every business is unique and every business is driven to improve results. Our organization offers real business experience across all corporate levels, training and workshops on how to succeed in the world of business, challenging projects that will help cultivate creativity and foster growth, a personal mentor who will guide you through your experiences and assignments, and academic credit.

We are seeking a college student who wants an IT internship that will challenge them and provide them with valuable experience to prepare them for their future careers.

- Work with a mentor who will guide you through completing daily IT-related tasks

- Support the IT team in the maintenance of hardware, software, and other systems

- Assist in the development of new desktops, servers or applications

- Work closely with a project team of staff to translate their messaging concepts into marketing materials

- Completion of introductory/intermediate computer science/information systems courses

o We do not provide basic education. Must have a strong foundation of IT/computer science knowledge to be able to apply what you know to the internship program.

- Ability to work in a fast-paced, competitive environment

- Ability to work remotely and a desire to learn

- Minimum commitment of 20 hrs/week for at least 3 months

o Must complete 250 total hours **

Why Xerox Copy Solutions?

- Receive academic credit

o Applicable to most internship programs at California universities. We will verify your hours for credit and complete any necessary forms/surveys.

- Real-world professional experience

o Gain first-hand professional experience working under Xerox, a Fortune-500 company.

- Resume building

o Have a leg up on the competition before graduating with professional experience on your resume.

- Recommendation Letter

o Upon completion of our internship program, you can receive a recommendation letter based on your performance.

- Apply your coursework and experience to a professional work environment

o Develop your professional communication skills, network, and learn real business processes.

- Choose your schedule

o We can accommodate to your busy class schedule, as long as you complete 20 hours a week!

Palo Alto
Ford Motor Company
Scientific Research/Envir Engr

Job Description & Qualifications

At Ford Motor Company, we believe freedom of movement drives human progress. We also believe in providing you with the freedom to define and realize your dreams. With our incredible plans for the future of mobility, we have a wide variety of opportunities for you to accelerate your career potential as you help us define tomorrow’s transportation.

Ford’s Research and Advanced Engineering team explores new vehicle and societal innovations that require some level of invention before they can be applied to our products and services. The team is building on a history of Ford innovation, including our invention of the three-way catalytic converter to modernize vehicle emissions controls in the 1970s and the world’s first rear inflatable seat belts in 2010.

Today, we are exploring and delivering ways to make smarter vehicles and our transportation system more efficient to improve people’s lives by helping them move more freely, safely and enjoyably. For example, we are changing how our products are made by creating high-quality vehicles in an environmentally and socially responsible way, including the use sustainable materials. Since 2000, we have used 12 industry and world-first plant-based materials in our production vehicles. We also are researching the possible use of tomato skin, bamboo, agave fiber, dandelion roots, algae and coffee chaff as part of our ambitious goal of making our vehicles with up of 20 percent sustainable material by 2025.

What you will be able to do
The Core – Artificial Intelligence – Machine Learning (AI-ML) research group, within Research and Advanced Engineering, is spearheading the process of discovery through and democratization of AI-ML across all engineering functions within the Ford product landscape. In order to realize a Ford vision of leadership, the Core-AI-ML research team, is looking for highly qualified and motivated individuals who are ready to seek ambitious multi-functional problems that require discovery through fundamental research in non-traditional directions.

As part of the Core AI-ML team, you will be responsible for conducting research for advancing the state-of-the–art in one or more areas of Computer Vision/Deep Learning. This role also requires general proficiency in software development for crafting end-to-end design frameworks for model development, training and deployment. The ideal candidate will be a fast learner and be flexible in embracing new directions of research. The candidate will have a proven track record to quickly develop a structured research portfolio and progress new concepts to support Ford’s emergent research objectives in the area of AI-ML. You will:
  • Implement and improve the state-of-the–art object detection, tracking and/or semantic segmentation models
  • Craft and implement end-to-end frameworks for data management, model development, training and deployment
  • Explore knowledge distillation-based algorithms for compression of deep models
  • Research knowledge graph and GNN for enhancing representation learning.
  • Write production-level code that is efficient, readable and extensible
  • Publish the results of the project in top-tier computer vision conferences
  • Independently solve problems and complete the project
The minimum requirements we seek
  • Pursuing Master’s Degree or PhD Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Physics or Robotics
  • 1+ years of experience in computer vision and image processing algorithm design and implementation (coursework/internship/co-op experience allowed)

Our preferred requirements
  • Knowledge of object detection and tracking, semantic segmentation, scene understating, multi-modal perception, time series (e.g., video sequences, etc.) and sensor fusion
  • Experience in image super resolution, Attention mechanism and interpretable AI, thermal cameras, model robustness/generalization and adversarial attacks
  • Proficient in Python, OpenCV, Sklearn, Numpy and Deep Learning frameworks (e.g. Pytorch, Tensorflow, etc.)
  • Proficient in Object Oriented programming, software architecture, data structure and algorithms
  • Self-motivated, responsible, excellent written and verbal interpersonal skills

What you will receive in return
As part of the Ford family, you will enjoy excellent compensation and a comprehensive benefits package that includes generous PTO, retirement, savings and stock investment plans, incentive compensation and much more. You will also experience exciting opportunities for professional and personal growth and recognition.

If you have what it takes to help us redefine the future of mobility, we would love to have you join us.

Visa sponsorship may be available for this position.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.

For information on Ford’s benefits and compensation, click here: https://corporate.ford.com/content/dam/corporate/us/en-us/documents/careers/2021-benefits-and-comp-GSR-sal-plan-3.pdf

Job Summary

The Summer Intern program at CooperSurgical provides university students with the opportunity to participate in meaningful projects that contribute to the overall business unit objectives. In addition to the assigned projects, Interns are given the opportunity to participate in activities that encourage networking with peers, managers, and employees.

Essential Functions

  • Understand the business and system scope and requirements
  • Suggest technical solutions using documentation (diagrams included)
  • Analyze/Validate/Test the integration deliverables against the scope/requirements
  • Work hands-on with SQL query writing and accessing APIs
  • Performs other related duties as assigned

Scope

  • The intern in this role will be a valuable team member of the integration team to help the team in understanding the business and system scope and requirements; And analyzing the deliveries to validate/test against the scope/requirements.
  • The intern will interact with system analysts, software engineers, and project managers of various teams who are working collaboratively with the integration team and will participate in the status and global team meetings to gain valuable interaction experience.

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

  • Intermediate skill in the use of Excel and Word.
  • Intermediate skill in writing relational database queries (e.g. SQL).
  • Beginners or intermediate skills using Postman, SOAPUI, or similar API tools.
  • Solid understanding of ETL processes, JSON and XML structures, and REST/SOAP APIs concepts.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills. Professional demeanor.
  • Positive problem-solving attitude and ability to team-play is a must.
  • Well organized with attention to detail.

Experience

  • Not required, but prior Internship experience is a plus.

Education

  • Current university student, majoring in Computer Science/Engineering, Business, or related subjects, entering their Junior or Senior year.
  • Completed at least two course works either in computer science/engineering, programming, database management, system analysis, business analysis, quality assurance, or in a discipline related to the knowledge, skills, and abilities required.

CooperSurgical is an equal employment opportunity employer and strong advocate of workforce diversity. Minority/Female/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Disability/Veteran

Overview:
Omnitracs, LLC is the source for private and for-hire fleets seeking fleet management solutions, including software applications, platforms, and information services. Our intuitive technologies, including solutions for safety and compliance, driver retention, GPS fleet tracking, and fleet maintenance software, can help you solve common fleet problems and achieve your fleet management objectives. With thousands of trucking customers across the Americas, Omnitracs leads the way for fleet management solutions.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
Firmware QA intern positions involve testing the firmware in Omnitracs products and find potential defects before the FW is released to customers. Testing involves test case creation, test scripts creation. testing and analysis of test results. This involves setting up and monitoring the products in the lab environment. Both automation and manual methods of testing are carried out

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:
  • Testing the FW of Omnitracs products
  • Maintain the lab automation setup
  • Create dashboards and monitor the reliability of FW
  • Write automation scripts to test the FW under development
  • Monitor quality during beta testing using different quality KPIs

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Bachelor’s degree in engineering or Computer Science
  • Knowledge in Linux operating System
  • Scripting in Python

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
  • Interest in SW/FW testing and Quality analysis
  • Knowledge in Data Analytics/Data science
  • Know-how of Splunk/Tableau/Kibana

OUR PROGRAM:
  • Personal and professional development
  • 1:1 Mentorship Opportunities
  • Executive Speaker Series
  • Fun and engaging social events
  • Rated the “Standout Virtual Internship Program of 2020” by WayUp

PROGRAM DURATION:
June 2021 – August 2021 (9 weeks-Remote)

Facebook Agile Silicon Team (FAST) focuses on delivering Facebook's vision through Augmented Reality (AR). Compute power requirements of Augmented Reality require custom silicon. FAST is driving the state of the art forward with breakthrough work in computer vision, machine learning, mixed reality, graphics, displays, and new ways to map the human body. Our chips will enable AR devices where our real and virtual world will mix and match throughout the day. We believe the only way to achieve our goals is to look at the entire stack, from transistor, through architecture to firmware and algorithms.FAST is looking for a Silicon Performance Architecture Intern who will work with a world-class group of engineers. The ideal candidate will understand the performance tradeoffs for various compute, memory and interconnect components in the context of heterogeneous systems with traditional CPU, GPU components and custom accelerators.
  • Carry out performance & power architecture exploration through detailed modeling and analysis of custom compute components, shared interconnect in a heterogeneous multi-agent system and/or shared cache/memory subsystem in a heterogeneous multi-agent system
  • Explore new methodologies to rapidly explore a vast design space from a performance/power standpoint
  • Understand the tradeoffs between general purpose and custom compute mechanisms
  • Understand the data flow paths, working set sizes, access patterns of different general purpose vs. custom compute components
  • QoS, latency and throughput analysis in heterogeneous platforms with multiple agents with competing resource requirements
  • Add support for measuring power in the model
  • Must obtain work authorization in the country of employment at the time of hire and maintain ongoing work authorization during employment
  • Currently has, or is in the process of obtaining, a PhD degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or related field
  • 1+ years experience in software design with C++
  • 1+ years experience in performance modeling and architectural exploration methodologies

SRI International’s Center for Vision Technologies offers end-to-end computer vision solutions that translate into real-world applications. Our scientists have pioneered real-time, real-world systems in multimodal (text, audio, and vision) analytics, Machine Learning (ML), stereo processing, object recognition, activity recognition, reinforcement learning and integrated sensor and processing solutions. position: Drive Assist Technologies – Internship Research & Advanced Engineering
description:
Palo Alto
Ford Motor Company
Product Development

Job Description & Qualifications

At Ford Motor Company, we believe freedom of movement drives human progress. We also believe in providing you with the freedom to define and realize your dreams. With our incredible plans for the future of mobility, we have a wide variety of opportunities for you to accelerate your career potential as you help us define tomorrow’s transportation.

Ford’s Research and Advanced Engineering team explores new vehicle and societal innovations that require some level of invention before they can be applied to our products and services. The team is building on a history of Ford innovation, including our invention of the three-way catalytic converter to modernize vehicle emissions controls in the 1970s and the world’s first rear inflatable seat belts in 2010.

Today, we are exploring and delivering ways to make smarter vehicles and our transportation system more efficient to improve people’s lives by helping them move more freely, safely and enjoyably. For example, we are changing how our products are made by creating high-quality vehicles in an environmentally and socially responsible way, including the use sustainable materials. Since 2000, we have used 12 industry and world-first plant-based materials in our production vehicles. We also are researching the possible use of tomato skin, bamboo, agave fiber, dandelion roots, algae and coffee chaff as part of our ambitious goal of making our vehicles with up of 20 percent sustainable material by 2025.

What you will be able to do
Looking for a great answer to the question – what did you do this summer? This is it! You will gain the experience, knowledge and skills to take your career to another level. Throughout this program, you will enjoy hands-on involvement in some of the groundbreaking initiatives we have happening. In addition to developing technically and professionally, you will be able to build a network of friends and contacts while discovering what it is like to live, work and play in Palo Alto, California.

Ford Greenfield Labs (GFL) – Palo Alto is leading the way to deliver breakthrough technology and services that will delight our customers. Our diverse team of employees exhibits a passion for the creative application of engineering and science to address the modern challenges of mobility. Audit & Risk Management Internship

Job Description
During your Summer internship, you will work closely with experienced professionals as an active member of a diverse and innovative team to help us achieve our mission of helping the world Move Cleaner, Create Smarter and Live Better. This opportunity will provide you with real-world experience to bring to your future full-time career. Students will strive to make our environment more secure by assisting in the execution of audits and risk management assessments. This will include exposure to many different processes and teams across the organization providing a variety of experiences. You will have the opportunity to work with several teams such as Information Security and Compliance team, Internal Audit, and potentially external auditors to execute the work and remediate any potential issues. Close collaboration with individuals across the global Information Solutions department will be required to gather evidence to ensure our solutions are designed and operating effectively.

Qualifications
  • Active student pursuing an undergraduate degree in Accounting, Information Technology, or other business or technology related fields.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Excellent computer skills, including Microsoft Office and SharePoint.
  • Ability to work under pressure and under fluctuating deadlines.
  • Ability to interact with a variety of personnel easily and professionally.
  • Students with a 3.0 or greater GPA will be given priority consideration.
  • Must be authorized to work in the United States without requiring work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future.

Benefits
  • Join 8-10 other co-op and intern students for our Summer rotation.
  • Students receive a variety of opportunities in our Information Solutions department.
  • Work alongside experienced professionals to help achieve our missions of helping the world Move Cleaner, Create Smarter and Live Better.
  • Students explore a variety of opportunities in the main areas of our department: Application Services, Business Processes, and Infrastructure.
  • Competitive hourly wage with tenure-based raises.
  • Paid holidays within your work period.
  • Semesterly philanthropy, networking, and professional development events.

With multiple facilities in and around Cleveland, Ohio, Lubrizol is located in one of the largest economic regions in the United States. Buzzing with business, culture, knowledge and entertainment, Northeast Ohio is a vibrant place for people of all ages and walks of life to live, learn, work and play. This region offers a little bit of everything for everyone - ethnically-diverse communities, affordable housing, award-winning schools and universities, world-class healthcare, indoor waterparks and zoos, ski resorts, museums, halls of fame, one of the longest water-fronts in the country, and the most concentrated square mile of art, cultural, education and health institutions in the nation. UNDP is committed to achieving workforce diversity in terms of gender, nationality and culture. Individuals from minority groups, indigenous groups and persons with disabilities are equally encouraged to apply. All applications will be treated with the strictest confidence.

UNDP does not tolerate sexual exploitation and abuse, any kind of harassment, including sexual harassment, and discrimination. All selected candidates will, therefore, undergo rigorous reference and background checks.



Background


The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) Information Technology Management office (ITM) in New York is responsible for supporting UNDP Country Offices around the world with Information Technology (IT) solutions. We seek to promote the use of the latest technological advances and solutions across UNDP to further our global impact on the development efforts of the international community. Geographic Information Systems (GIS software) is a cutting-edge tool that can be applied to an array of our global projects related to the environment, energy, and poverty. The ITM GIS Team was formed to promote GIS solutions and expand its use in the planning and implementation of all relevant projects in our country offices and regional bureaux.

Our Unit offers a stimulating and versatile internship in an international environment with contact to various partners from some 166 countries with UNDP presence. We are a team who work in a dynamic and informal atmosphere, and we expect our interns to become vital members of the team. The UNDP/ITM Geospatial Sciences Internship programme enhances the academic life experience of passionate students as interns and empowers them to become socially responsible, innovative, and environmentally conscious leaders of tomorrow. As an intern, you will also gain worldwide connections with other top-talented interns and UN staff from other agencies and be given tasks and opportunities that have a direct global impact on international development efforts




Duties and Responsibilities


  • Assist the GIS Team to develop technical solutions. including a machine learning model, using Earth Observation data to detect changes to built-up areas along the coastline of West-Point, Liberia, with source code that can be expanded to other areas of interests;
  • Assist in developing algorithms and mathematical or statistical models using Earth Observation data and local ground information;
  • Use ESRI GIS products to communicate results including dashboards, storymaps, etc.;
  • Contribute to draft quality focused training material, procedures, instructions and templates from best practice and disseminate through a Practice Community;
  • Assist in hosting webinars and presenting/explaining GIS solutions that are developed in-house to country offices.



Competencies


  • Geospatial data: has experience working with GIS data including vector and raster datasets, geo-tagged data, remote sensing data products including satellite imagery;
  • Data Science: has prior experience writing code and developing scripts for machine learning modeling and geospatial analysis, preferably using python and ArcGIS;
  • Communication: communicates effectively when working in teams and have a proactive attitude with a goal-oriented mind-set;
  • International Development: knowledge of UNDP global efforts and an enthusiasm for working in an international organization;
  • Collaboration: displays cultural, gender, religion, race, nationality and age sensitivity and adaptability and Interest and motivation in working in an international organization.



Required Skills and Experience


Education:

  • You are currently in the final year of your bachelor’s degree; or you are currently enrolled in a Master’s degree; or you have graduated no longer than 1 year ago from a master’s degree or equivalent studies;
  • Preferred educational background in the field of computer science, data science, mathematics, engineering, geography, or equivalent;

Experience:

  • Knowledge in one of the following fields is required: machine learning, mathematical modelling, geospatial analysis, satellite data processing;
  • Knowledge in ArcGIS Online/ Enterprise platforms, Microsoft Azure is an advantage;
  • Knowledge in developing API scripts and scripting languages is an advantage;
  • Experience with gathering, consolidating and analysing data from databases and reports is an advantage;
  • Interest in developing sustainable solutions for country offices, focusing on GIS and Earth Observation data;

Language:

  • Fluent in written and spoken English is required.
  • Working Knowledge of other UN languages is an advantage.


Conditions:

  • UNDP will not pay for the internship but will provide a monthly stipend in accordance with the provisions of the UNDP Internship policy. All other expenses connected with it will be borne by the intern or sponsoring Government or institution;
  • Where an intern is financially supported by an institution, government or third party, UNDP will pay the intern the difference, if any, between the external financial support provided and the applicable UNDP stipend;
  • Except for the stipend, all other expenses connected with the internship will be borne by the intern, sponsoring government or institutions;
  • Interns are responsible for securing adequate medical insurance for the duration of their internship with UNDP and must provide a medical certificate of good health prior to starting the internship;
  • There is no expectation of employment following the internship;
  • The intern is responsible for obtaining necessary visas and arranging travel to and from the duty station where the internship will be performed.

Organization Summary

Lindsay Corporation is a global company, headquartered in Omaha, Nebraska, focused on providing irrigation and infrastructure solutions to meet the needs of a growing population. As one of the world’s leading providers of irrigation and water management, its Zimmatic systems are operating in more than 90 countries. Lindsay Corporation’s infrastructure division offers a wide range of products that aid in roadway maintenance and transportation safety. Since 1955, Lindsay Corporation has been at the forefront of research and development of products and services designed to meet the needs of a constantly evolving world.


Position Description

Lindsay Corporation is hiring a Software Engineering Intern for the Summer of 2021 within its overall software organization. This internship will assist in designing, implementing, and delivering software solutions for Lindsay’s various product lines, including new products and features. Additionally, this role will also be responsible for performing maintenance on existing products and solutions, as assigned each development sprint. This is a hands-on opportunity to get real work experience while learning software engineering best practices, learning from some extremely talented and experienced engineers.


Position Details

This is an internship position that will be based in our Omaha, NE office. There will be no travel and the candidate should be prepared and able to work remotely.


Duties & Responsibilities

  • Assists in developing, testing, and delivering high quality web and mobile app solutions, including new products and features
  • Assists in new product development efforts, delivering new solutions on time and within the functional specifications
  • Performs routine maintenance on the existing codebase for the various Lindsay products and solutions, as assigned during each sprint
  • Codes and configures software functionality according to functional specifications
  • Unit tests code and debugs thoroughly prior to hand-off
  • Researches and resolves reported software problems efficiently, accurately, and in a timely manner
  • Adheres to the Lindsay software organization’s coding standards and guidelines, as well as the group's various processes, policies, and procedures
  • Clearly communicates issues and roadblocks in order to maintain sprint scope and efficiency


Preferred Qualifications

  • Current student who has successfully completed at least their first year of study for an undergraduate bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or similar, relevant field.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment where constant iteration, improvement, and innovation is key to the success of the team
  • Robust problem-solving skills, the ability to learn from doing, personal accountability, and a positive and professional attitude
  • Ability to clearly and rapidly communicate problems and solutions in order to prevent bottlenecks and facilitate the release process
  • Understanding of one or more of the following is preferred: Web APIs, IoT device communication and protocols, Agile Scrum, Git Flow
  • Demonstrated proficiency with one or more of the following languages is preferred, but not required:
    • C#/.NET Core
    • Angular

Position Description

Lindsay Corporation is hiring a Data Science Intern for the Summer of 2021 within its overall software organization. This internship will assist in designing, developing, testing, and delivering high quality data science and analytical solutions, including new products and features for Lindsay’s various customer-facing software solutions. Additionally, this role will assist with new data science initiatives and research projects, working closely with the Data Science and Software Engineering teams to deliver these solutions and projects on time and within the function specifications.


Position Details

This is an internship position that will be based in our Omaha, NE office. There will be no travel and the candidate should be prepared and able to work remotely.


Duties & Responsibilities

  • Assists in designing, developing, testing, and delivering high quality data science and analytical solutions, including new products and features
  • Assists with new data science initiatives and research projects, working closely with the Data Science and Software Engineering teams to deliver solutions and projects on time and within the function specifications
  • Develops stories and visualizations to effectively communicate complex analysis in a clear, precise manner in order to industrialize data science products
  • Performs advanced statistical analyses and data mining using state of the art methods, develops mathematical models to simulate outcomes and behavior
  • Adheres to the Lindsay software organization’s coding standards and guidelines, as well as the group's various processes, policies, and procedures
  • Clearly communicates issues and roadblocks in order to maintain project scope and efficiency


Preferred Qualifications

  • Current student with at least 3 years of coursework (Junior or higher) working towards a bachelor’s degree, master’s degree, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, MIS, Statistics, Mathematics, or a similar, related field
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment where constant iteration, improvement, and innovation is key to the success of the team
  • Robust problem-solving skills, the ability to learn from doing, personal accountability, and a positive and professional attitude
  • Ability to clearly and rapidly communicate problems and solutions in order to prevent bottlenecks and facilitate the release process
  • Demonstrated proficiency with the following technologies and tools is preferred, but not required:
    • Statistical/general-purpose programming languages (R, Python, C#/.NET etc.)
    • Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence tools (Azure ML, Google ML, etc.)

Who We Are

Samsara, founded in 2015, is a leader in Industrial IoT and our mission is to increase the efficiency, safety, and sustainability of the operations that power our economy. Our solutions combine hardware and software to bring real-time visibility, analytics, and AI to operations across various industries. Samsara's fast-growing team is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in San Jose, Atlanta, and London. Our team has raised $930M from Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst, Tiger Global, Dragoneer, AllianceBernstein Holding LP, Franklin Templeton, General Atlantic, Sands Capital Management and Warburg Pincus LLC.

At Samsara, we welcome all. All sizes, colors, cultures, sexes, beliefs, religions, ages, people. We depend on the unique approaches of our team members to help us solve complex problems. We are committed to increasing diversity across our team and ensuring that Samsara is a place where people from all backgrounds can make an impact.

We are looking for talented engineers to join our firmware team! Please note we only have internship opportunities during Summer 2021.

Firmware engineers develop the software that powers our hardware devices. While some of your work may involve working with low-level microcontrollers, your time will largely be spent developing in Golang (most of our devices run Linux environments!). You will work on anything from creating control interfaces for new hardware to designing server-device communication protocols.

We use Golang for our firmware and backend, Typescript and React for our web client, GraphQL to fetch data from our backend, and React Native for our mobile app. Direct experience with these technologies is not required.

An ideal candidate would:

  • Complete a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field between Fall/Winter 2021 - Summer 2022
  • Have built or worked on production applications
  • Enjoy understanding our users and what would make their day to day processes easier to manage
  • Love shipping features that are immediately used by our customers
  • Seek to iterate on new products based on customer feedback

Benefits

Working at Samsara has its perks: for all full-time global employees, we provide private medical and dental insurance plus growth and development opportunities, as well as regular virtual team and company events. In the US we offer flexible vacation time, EMEA employees receive 25 vacation days plus national bank holidays. Post-COVID we'll be back in our global offices with numerous in-office perks.

Accommodations

Samsara is an inclusive work environment, and we are committed to ensuring equal opportunity in employment for qualified persons with disabilities. Please let us know if you require any reasonable accommodations for your interview (e.g., sign language interpreters, reading assistance, facility access, device or equipment modification, etc.)

Regarding COVID-19

With the spread of COVID-19, Samsara's global offices will remain closed until further notice except for employees that require access to hardware and lab equipment.

Our primary concern is for the health and well-being of our employees as well as candidates. We have transitioned all interviews and onboarding to be conducted virtually via Zoom video conferencing. Employees are also able to work remotely through June 2021 from any US state or country in which they have a valid work authorization. All employees are expected to return to our offices when they reopen except for field-based and fully remote roles.

If you have any questions or concerns before applying, feel free to contact us at jobs@samsara.com.

position: Machine Learning / Product Engineering / Software Engineering Internship
description:
The world is changing at an accelerating rate and understanding the shifting landscapes has never been more critical. Primer is the premier artificial-intelligence powered platform that allows humans to get information that they need, instantly, in ways that until now have not been possible. We believe that truth is knowable; our mission is to free the curious to be their most human. We are building machines that can read natural language text documents, understand them, correlate them into events, and share what they learn by writing their own natural language text documents.
At Primer we use machine learning and natural language processing to automate the analysis of very large corpora of unstructured text. We build systems that read documents, extract insights, and write reports comparable to those of a human analyst. Our objective is to help our customers understand the world around them –– from geopolitical events and scientific research to changes in the risk profiles of companies. Our clients include some of the world’s largest corporations, financial institutions, and government agencies. You can learn more about Primer's technology and the sort of problems we solve at our blog, as well as recent media coverage of our work.

Primer is looking for talented college and graduate students with a passion for problem solving, research, and building tools that tackle the hardest challenges. We want people to help us expand what we believe to be possible. Join us to leverage cutting edge algorithms at massive scales as we seek to build the tools behind the decisions that change the world. At Primer, you’ll grow your technical expertise while helping some of the world’s largest companies and elite national security organizations solve their most pressing challenges.

What You’ll Do

  • Work with large, complex, constantly changing data sets.
  • Develop strong skills in data exploration, cleaning, modeling, programming, software architecture, and visualization.
  • Develop, train, and deploy Production models and functionality from the start of task definition to implementation.
  • Collaborate with research, engineering, and sales teams.
  • Imagine, plan, and create your own NLP research project.
  • Work across a microservices architecture that processes millions of documents per day.

Requirements

  • Currently has or is in the process of obtaining their BA/BS, Master’s, or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Engineering, or other quantitative fields.
  • Willingness to learn new techniques and enjoy working on open-ended projects.
  • Proficiency in Python and web frameworks such as Flask / Django or related technologies.
  • Experience in PyTorch, Tensorflow, Pandas, ElasticSearch, Postgres, or Transformer-based NLP models is a plus.

Frequently Asked Questions

  • When and how long is the internship?
    • Internships will last between 10 and 14 weeks from May-September. Applications for out-of-cycle internships will also be considered.
  • Where will the internship be?
    • Primer Offices are located in San Francisco and Washington, DC. Interns will have the option to work remotely.
  • What roles is Primer hiring for?
    • There are open internship positions for backend engineering, product engineering (data science), and machine learning
  • When are applications due?
    • Applications will be accepted and evaluated on a rolling basis.
  • What is the overall interview process?
    • The process starts with the initial resume and transcript screening. Primer will then reach out directly with qualified applications to schedule virtual interviews.
  • Is the internship paid?
    • Yes.

Primer is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Please see the United States Department of Labor's EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.
If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at info@primer.com.

position: Aircraft Protection Systems Software Co-op/Intern Summer 2021- ELSYS
description:
GTRI’s Cooperative Education (“co-op”) program offers you extensive opportunities to participate in diverse scientific and technological endeavors, use state-of-the-art equipment and rapidly improve your technical and leadership skills. The program allows you to alternate three semesters of full-time work at GTRI with semesters of full-time school.

The Electronic Systems Laboratory (ELSYS) is currently seeking a Co-op Student in the Test Engineering Division (TEN) for summer 2021. TEN researches next generation Aircraft Protection systems used to shield US and coalition aircraft from adversary radar and missile systems. These complex systems provide advance detection of adversary systems that enable aircraft to avoid or counter these systems and return home safely.

This broad range of research will provide a solid foundation for the student as a future hardware engineer. The student will work under the guidance of GTRI researchers performing research in one of the following areas -

  • Sensing and processing broad bands of the electromagnetic spectrum
  • Creating a complex electromagnetic environment used to test Aircraft Protection systems
  • Using Machine Learning for data analysis applications

The student researcher will perform one or more of the following activities -

  • Design, code, and debug of Windows Software (SW), Embedded Software (SW), or Linux (SW) for aircraft protection systems and aircraft protection systems test applications
  • Conduct testing of Windows, Embedded, or Linux Systems software

Required Minimum Qualifications

Co-op
  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
  • Must have a 3.0 or higher GPA
  • Must be registered for co-op credit with your university (Co-op only)

Intern

  • Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or Electrical Engineering
  • 3.0 or higher cumulative GPA
  • Must commit to a single semester full-time internship. The work term is May 2021-August 2021

Preferred Qualifications

  • Ability to perform research independently
  • Ability to prioritize tasks while working on multiple projects
  • Strong math skills and ability to learn complex engineering concepts
  • Experience in 1 or more programming languages (Example – C#, Python)
  • Ability to clearly communicate technical ideas to a non-technical audience

Hours per Week

40 hours per week

U.S. Citizenship Requirements

Due to our research contracts with the US federal government, candidates for this position are required to be US Citizens.

Clearance Type Required

Candidates must be able to obtain and maintain a Secret Clearance upon hire

Housing and Relocation

Housing and relocation assistance are not available for this position.

Location: Pittsburgh, PA

Cardiac Management Solutions


The Cardiac Management Solutions division of ZOLL Medical Corporation develops products to protect and manage cardiac patients, including the LifeVest® wearable cardioverter defibrillator (WCD), the ZOLL cardiac monitor, and associated technologies.

Heart disease is the leading cause of death for both men and women in the U.S. At ZOLL, your work will help to ensure cardiac patients get the life-saving therapy they need. To date, the LifeVest WCD has been worn by hundreds of thousands of patients and saved thousands of lives.

ZOLL has been Pittsburgh’s Manufacturer of the Year, one of Western PA’s Healthiest Employers, and even one of Pittsburgh’s Coolest Offices. But it’s our unique opportunity to impact people’s lives that makes ZOLL the ideal place to build your career.

Job purpose

The User Experience (UX) Design Intern contributes to the development of current and future generations of the LifeVest and related software products. UX Designer Interns are part of a collaborative team including researchers, human factors, marketing professionals, software developers, and internal stakeholders that help brainstorm, ideate, and create user interfaces and processes for our medical device products.

Duties and responsibilities

  • Design wireframes and mockups with GUI design tools.
  • Interview internal and external stakeholders and users.
  • Aid in user testing, create protocols, run tests, create reports, and conduct data analysis.
  • Iterate on designs based on user feedback, metrics, usability findings, and design critiques.
  • Innovate on existing ideas and produce new ways to help patients and other users.
  • Create design documentation and execute user research activities.

Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled or have experience in Human Computer Interaction Design, Computer Science, Design, Fine Arts, Behavioral Science, Psychology, Human Factors or a related field.
  • Experience with Sketch, Figma, Adobe XD, or other GUI design tools.
  • Understanding of web and mobile GUI best practices.
  • Experience creating low fidelity prototypes.
  • Experience with user testing.
  • Portfolio with 2-3 examples of your design work
  • demonstrating the design process.

Working conditions

This position is generally performed in a typical office environment that is usually quiet. Employee is expected to work collaboratively with team members, as well as able to work independently with limited supervision. Work will require significant computer and telephone work.

Physical requirements

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to sit, talk and hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand and walk. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds.

Supervisory responsibility

This position has no supervisory responsibility.

ZOLL is committed to fostering an inclusive workplace, where unique identities, backgrounds, cultures, perspectives and experiences are respected and valued.

position: Data Engineer and Integration Developer, Paid Internship
description:
** The job descriptions will vary depending on the individual project but here are the primary roles you could be working on after internship **

Descriptions of some of them: **

***SQL Developer

**Responsibilities

  • Help write and optimize in-application SQL statements.
  • Ensure performance, security, and availability of databases.
  • Prepare documentation and specifications.
  • Handle common database procedures such as upgrade, backup, recovery, migration, etc.
  • Write TSQL scripts and objects such as stored procedures, user-defined functions, views, indexes per business requirements.
  • Create ETL SSIS packages to migrate data from OLTP sources to OLAP destinations through available tasks and transformations in SSIS.
  • Design and create user-interactive reports in SSRS, Power BI, and Tableau.
  • Profile server resource usage, and optimize and tweak as necessary.
  • Collaborate with other team members and stakeholders.

**Qualifications

  • BS or MS of a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or a related field is required
  • Proficiency with SQL and its variation among popular databases
  • Skilled at optimizing large complicated SQL statements
  • Capable of configuring popular database engines and orchestrating clusters as necessary
  • Ability to plan resource requirements from high-level specifications
  • Good communication skills

***Business Intelligence Developer

  • Maintain, support, and enhance the business intelligence data backend, including data warehouses and data lakes.
  • Build interfaces between the business intelligence systems and other colleges' information systems to maintain a timely and accurate integration of data.
  • Collaborate and work with data analysts in various departments to ensure that data meets their reporting and analysis need.
  • Provide technical guidance for design and implementation of data governance systems and policy.
  • Work extensively towards SQL Server development in writing core TSQL scripts to implement complex business logic.
  • Develop SSIS packages to implement complex ETL strategies as a part of business requirements for the population of dimensional data structures.
  • Work on creating SSAS cubes and various cube objects such as KPIs (Key Performance Indicators), calculated members, attribute hierarchies, and perspectives.
  • Design eye-catching reports with data from OLTP database, dimensional data structure and OLAP cubes for business reporting purposes.
  • Keep abreast of new business intelligence technologies

**Qualifications

  • BS or MS of a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or a related field is required
  • At least 1 year of experience using Microsoft SQL Server Database, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS is required
  • Experience with other relational databases, BI reporting and data discovery tools are preferred

***Data Analyst/Engineer

**Responsibilities:

  • Provides plan with data, reporting, and analyses that enable data driven decision making.
  • Provides summary analyses in written and oral presentation settings.
  • Builds database from scratch. And prepares complex presentations.
  • Develops system test cases and documents results, researches system issues, and documents findings.

**Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics
  • Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
  • Understanding of addressing and metadata standards
  • High-level written and verbal communication skills

***Junior Data Analyst/Engineer

**Responsibilities:

  • Managing master data, including creation, updates, and deletion.
  • Managing users and user roles.
  • Provide quality assurance of imported data, working with quality assurance analyst if necessary.
  • Commissioning and decommissioning of data sets.
  • Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines.
  • Helping develop reports and analyses.
  • Managing and designing the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata.
  • Supporting the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements.
  • Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization.
  • Assessing tests and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems.
  • Generating reports from single or multiple systems.
  • Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports.
  • Evaluating changes and updates to source production systems.
  • Training end-users on new reports and dashboards.
  • Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing.

**Requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics
  • 1-3 years of work experience as a data analyst or in a related field is preferred
  • Ability to work with stakeholders to assess potential risks.
  • Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide a software solution recommendations.
  • Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms.
  • High-level experience in methodologies and processes for managing large scale databases.
  • Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases.
  • Understanding of addressing and metadata standards.
  • High-level written and verbal communication skills.

Hennepin County's Core Values
Under each core value, find Hennepin County's definition for what it means to us.

Acknowledging and affirming diverse cultures, identities, and experiences to build relationships. Listening to others’ points of view and exercising openness and mindfulness.
2.) Customer Service
Listening, showing empathy, serving through problem solving, meeting needs, and creating a positive customer experience.
3.) Employee Engagement
The ability to work across different groups or areas, taking responsibility for actions, and seeking ways to collaborate with others.

Using creativity and problem solving to approach challenges and support change.

Taking responsibility for your own development and pursuing learning opportunities.

The Lubrizol Corporation, a Berkshire Hathaway company, is a market-driven global company serving customers in more than 100 countries. Audit & Risk Management Internship


Job Description

During your Summer internship, you will work closely with experienced professionals as an active member of a diverse and innovative team to help us achieve our mission of helping the world Move Cleaner, Create Smarter and Live Better. This opportunity will provide you with real-world experience to bring to your future full-time career. Students will strive to make our environment more secure by assisting in the execution of audits and risk management assessments. This will include exposure to many different processes and teams across the organization providing a variety of experiences. You will have the opportunity to work with several teams such as Information Security and Compliance team, Internal Audit, and potentially external auditors to execute the work and remediate any potential issues. Close collaboration with individuals across the global Information Solutions department will be required to gather evidence to ensure our solutions are designed and operating effectively.

Benefits

With multiple facilities in and around Cleveland, Ohio, Lubrizol is located in one of the largest economic regions in the United States. Buzzing with business, culture, knowledge and entertainment, Northeast Ohio is a vibrant place for people of all ages and walks of life to live, learn, work and play. This region offers a little bit of everything for everyone - ethnically-diverse communities, affordable housing, award-winning schools and universities, world-class healthcare, indoor waterparks and zoos, ski resorts, museums, halls of fame, one of the longest water-fronts in the country, and the most concentrated square mile of art, cultural, education and health institutions in the nation. We are currently seeking candidates who are working towards obtaining a Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Biochemistry or related fields for a virtual internship for the summer of 2021.

  • Analyze large LC/MS-MS datasets
  • Identify physical and chemical properties that may be important to isomerization/succinimide or aggregation formation from literature
  • Use modeling software to build and analyze 3D structures of antibodies and next generation protein therapies

This work contributes to our platform knowledge database by helping predict isomerization rates and potential impact to product shelf life.

Our portfolio of smart networks, software, services, meters and sensors helps our customers better manage electricity, gas and water resources for the people they serve. By working with our customers to ensure their success, we help improve the quality of life, ensure the safety and promote the well-being of millions of people around the globe. Itron is dedicated to creating a more resourceful world. Join us: www.itron.com.

#LI-JB1

Itron is at the forefront of a rapidly evolving global industry. Through innovative technology and services, we are working to create more insightful utilities, smarter cities and a more resourceful world. Join us.

Become involved with software security fault analysis for state-of-the-art utility meters, access points, and mesh network equipment distributed globally. Learn how to work inside a large distributed multinational corporation to guide and set corporate security standards to ensure the attestation of product security.

This paid internship is intended to start immediately, 20-25 hrs/wk, and continue through summer with 40 hrs/wk possible during academic breaks.

Duties & Responsibilities

  • Perform various application security assessment activities including white-box and black-box penetration testing, static code analysis, code reviews, etc. on software products and applications
  • Collaborate in development of tools for automation
  • Assist in the implementation and integration of security in SDLC and DevOps pipelines
  • Research efficient, practical and applicable mitigation strategies to remediate identified security vulnerabilities
  • Assist in educating developer community on best practices and develop secure coding guidelines
  • Evaluate application security tools for internal use and implementations

Experience
Education: Must be currently enrolled in an accredited and related degree program (Computer Science, Computer Engineering) with completion of at least one year of university level coursework. Preference for candidates who have completed multiple courses related to cybersecurity or information security.

  • Relevant programming experience in several languages: C, C++, Java, JavaScript, C# .NET, ASP.NET, Ruby, Objective C, Android, TypeScript
  • Basic understanding of cryptographic key algorithms and network security
  • Basic understanding of security fundamentals and strategies: defense-in-depth methodology, C.I.A. security pillars
  • Professional verbal and written communication skills

Preferred Skills & Experience

  • Familiarity with identifying and protecting against web application and web service security vulnerabilities including those found in the OWASP Top 10 and CWE Top 25.
  • Familiarity with security testing tools to perform various forms of security testing such as static analysis, dynamic analysis and penetration testing
  • Experience in scripting languages: PowerShell, Bash, Python, etc.
  • Familiarity with Azure DevOps, IoT and Container technologies

Travel: 0-10%
