Job Description:
Summary This paid internship will assist in all areas of technical operations for the Brewer’s front office and American Family Field. The ideal candidate will be able to work 15 - 25 hours per week depending on department workload and class schedule.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Other duties may be assigned.
  • Work with IT staff to field and log all basic trouble tickets and service requests
  • Assist with support of desktop and laptop computers, printers, telephones and mobile devices
  • Provide in-person, verbal/over-the-phone and email support to onsite and remote users
  • Assist with configuring and distributing new desktop and laptop computers
  • Assist with small application development projects and enhancements to existing applications
  • Assist in implementing special projects
  • Prepare documentation related to IT policies and procedures
  • Organize and maintain IT assets and inventory
  • Troubleshoot and research solutions for end-user device issues

Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.

  • Desire to work with people in a demanding yet highly rewarding industry
  • Familiarity with networking, computers and mobile devices
  • Experience with desktop applications especially Windows 10, Microsoft Office 2016 Suite and Apple Mac OS (preferred)
  • Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Detail oriented, organized and thorough in order to best serve end-users
  • Structured approach to problem solving and ability to document common processes and procedures
  • Committed to going “above and beyond” to serve the customer
  • Ability to lift 50 lbs. and handle physically challenging tasks
  • Availability to work standard support hours (M-F, 9-5) along with occasional after-hours and weekend support
Education and/or Experience
Student within three or four semesters of completing an accredited college degree in computer science or information technology; or three to six months related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Computer Skills
To perform the job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of Microsoft Office software including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

Language Skills
Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos. Ability to write simple correspondence. Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.

Mathematical Skills
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.

Reasoning Ability
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.

Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel and talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to reach with hands and arms. The employee is occasionally required to stand; walk; sit and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must regularly lift and /or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision and ability to adjust focus.

Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly exposed to outside weather conditions, which may include heat, cold and various forms of precipitation.
The employee is occasionally exposed to moving mechanical parts.
The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.

Work Hours
Business hours are Monday – Friday 9 am – 5pm, however, additional hours may be required on weekends, evenings and some holidays. Additional hours may also be required as part of an on-call rotation to cover some weekends, evenings, and holidays throughout the year.

Tethers Unlimited, Inc. is a 65-person aerospace production and R&D company located in Bothell, WA. Founded in 1994, we're nimble, resourceful and fun, and we work on a variety of cool cutting-edge projects in the space industry.

MAKING A POSITIVE IMPACT AT TETHERS UNLIMITED, INC (TUI): Build technology that will go to space! Our company innovates technology to make a wide array of products and projects, everything from software defined radios, Hydros water-based thrusters, antenna pointing gimbals and many others to Connect the Universe. At Tethers we are still a small enough company that you will have a huge impact, yet large enough to provide you the resources needed to grow and be effective. Much larger companies haven’t flown anywhere near the number of products into space that we have. So, if you want to make your mark and be part of the next mission, now is the time to apply.

SUMMARY/OBJECTIVE: This is an opportunity, as an Embedded Software Developer Intern, to work on new technologies as we expand our product capabilities such as our software defined radios. Tethers Unlimited has launched several products and continues to expand its in-space portfolio.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

  • Create additional embedded functionality for Tethers product lines such as our Software Defined Radio (SDR) or other Control Systems and supporting tools.
  • Follow standard development practices.

QUALIFICATIONS:

Required

  • Junior or Senior year student pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree or student working on Advanced Degree in Computer Science or other relevant engineering discipline required.
  • Experience programming in C/C++.
  • Working knowledge of software development toolchains such as GIT, Jenkins, Bitbucket.
  • Strong written and oral communication competency.

Desired

  • Experience programming embedded systems.
  • Understanding of wireless communication channels and modulation schemes.
  • Understanding of various networking protocols with an emphasis on the bottom 3 OSI layers.
  • Digital Signal Processing experience with FPGA’s or SOC.
  • Experience with Oscilloscopes, Logic or Spectrum Analyzers.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: This position has no direct supervisory responsibilities.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, use hands, and reach with hands and arms. Intermittent physical activity including bending, reaching, pushing, pulling, or lifting up to 40 lbs. May encounter prolonged periods of sitting.

EXPECTED HOURS OF WORK: This is a full-time position requiring a minimum of 40 hours per week.

TRAVEL: Some travel (less than two weeks per year) expected for this position.

WORK AUTHORIZATION/SECURITY CLEARANCE: ITAR Requirements: This position requires special security screenings to conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, which may include the ability to obtain a U.S. Security Clearance.

The U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship Exclusively.

OTHER DUTIES: Please note that this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

If this sounds like something you feel matches your interest and skillset, please apply with your resume and with any examples of your engineering documentation so far.

Why work for Tethers?

  • Exciting opportunities to make products that go into space, define the future of business in space.
  • We seek new ideas and fresh perspectives, innovation. Teamwork and collaboration are valued.
  • The team members that work here are awesome!

Some of our PERKS:

  • Easy Eastside commute to Bothell
  • Smart, engaged co-workers who value and support each other’s growth
  • Covered bicycle rack
  • Walking trails nearby

PLEASE NOTE: We are only considering local (Greater Seattle area) candidates at this time.

** PRINCIPALS ONLY. NO RECRUITERS PLEASE. **

TUI participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. and a U.S. Citizen only.

Overview:

We are proud to be a trusted provider of advanced X-ray technologies for ports, borders, military, high-threat facilities and critical infrastructure all over the world. Be a part of our mission to provide our customers with best-in-class cargo and vehicle screening systems and services so they can combat terrorism, trade fraud, drug and weapon smuggling, and illegal immigration.

We are seeking a computer vision and deep learning intern to conduct novel research in object detection and image classification. The ideal candidate should be able to investigate, develop, prototype, and evaluate new algorithms in computer vision and deep learning. The candidate should also be able to communicate research, document progress, and present results. Additional responsibilities for this internship include:

  • Demonstrate behavior consistent with the company’s Code of Ethics and Conduct
  • It is the responsibility of every employee to report to their manager or a member of senior management any quality problems or defects in order for corrective action to be implemented and to avoid recurrence of the problem

position: Software Engineer Intern (Machine Learning Platform Team - Spring/Summer 2021) - 2021 Grads
description:
Position: Software Engineer Intern (Machine Learning Platform Team - Spring/Summer 2021)

Location: San Jose, CA (Remote)

For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,500 companies and 100 Million threats detected a day.

We work in a fast paced, dynamic and make it happen culture. Our people are some of the brightest and passionate in the industry that thrive on being the first to solve problems. We are always looking to hire highly passionate, collaborative and humble people that want to make a difference.

Responsibilities:

At the biggest cloud security company, we are working with the massive scale of network data, security data, and enterprise data every day. We are seeking out engineering interns with a passion to build out tools and platforms, process and analyze data at scale, and solve real-world business problems.

As a backend software engineer intern within our Machine Learning platform, you have two main responsibilities:

1) You will help to build large-scale distributed systems to support the Machine Learning pipeline including data collection, feature engineering, model training, model evaluation, model deployment, and real-time serving.

2) You will apply analytical and math/statistics skills to stay on top of data and to ensure results are coherent and reliable.

You may not have any prior data science and ML background but you need to have a desire in building up knowledge in this area and tremendous curiosity in how the data can and will be utilized by the data scientist.

Required Skills:

  • Pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related field. Open to all May/June 2021 graduates
  • Strong algorithm, data structure, computer science background
  • Strong Python and SQL programming skills
  • Ability to learn, evaluate, and adopt new technologies fast

Desirable Skills:

  • Experience with Go, C++, or Javascript
  • Experience with setting up SQL/NoSql database such as Postgres, MongoDB, Redis, and table schema
  • Experience using distributed data processing such as Spark, BigQuery or Apache Beam
  • Experience with event messaging such as Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc
  • Experience working with Docker, Kubernetes
  • Experience with machine/deep learning related toolset/frameworks, such as Pandas, Numpy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch etc.
  • Experience with data serialization techniques and data stores for persisting events
  • Experience with Google cloud (or other public cloud)
  • Experience with building quality software by writing robust interfaces, considering design principles, and applying sound testing practices

Why Zscaler?

People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.

Learn more at zscaler.com or follow us on Twitter @zscaler. Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ : ZS ) is available at http://www.zscaler.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

Job Description

Our business analysts are the drivers behind our continued growth and success. With our commitment to innovation, it’s our business analysts who seek out, develop, and help implement strategic initiatives for improved efficiency and productivity. We’re currently searching for an experienced business analyst to help guide our organization into the future. From researching progressive systems solutions to evaluating their impact, our ideal candidate is a detailed planner, expert communicator, and top-notch analyst. They should be wholly committed to the discovery and development of innovative solutions in an ever-changing digital landscape.

Objectives of this Role

  • Drive identification of requirements across business units and identify substandard systems processes through evaluation of real-time data
  • Serve as thought leader for technical business processes, developing forward-thinking systems prototypes that promote increased efficiency and productivity on multiple levels
  • Create and implement precise management plans for every project, with attention to transparent communication at all levels
  • Perform, evaluate, and communicate thorough quality assurance at every stage of systems development
  • Determine and develop user requirements for systems in production, to ensure maximum usability

Daily and Monthly Responsibilities

  • Partner with other stakeholder teams across business units (i.e., sales, finance, security, compliance) to develop necessary analysis and documentation in a collaborative way, communicating effectively and efficiently with production, managerial, and executive teams
  • Evaluate, analyze, and communicate systems requirements on a continuing basis, and maintain systems processes, including the delivery of monthly status reports to all appropriate parties
  • Author and update internal and external documentation, and formally initiate and deliver requirements and documentation
  • Conduct daily systems analytics to maximize effectiveness and troubleshoot problems
  • Develop meaningful and lasting relationships with partners for optimized systems integration, and respond to questions and concerns from managers and executives with supporting research and recommendations

Skills and Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or relevant education.
  • Proven analytical abilities
  • Practical experience generating process documentation and reports
  • Excellent communicator with the ability to translate data into actionable insights

Preferred Qualifications

  • Strong working knowledge of relevant Microsoft applications, including Visio
  • Proven capabilities in project and user-testing management
  • Proven development of innovative and impactful systems solutions
  • Extensive experience with data visualization
  • Highly proficient technical writing capabilities

position: 2021 IDB Remote Summer Internship Program | Integration and Trade Sector (INT/TIN)
description:
2021 IDB Remote Summer Internship Program | Integration and Trade Sector INT/TIN


Background of this search:

Between 1990 and 2010, intra-regional trade among Latin American and Caribbean (LAC) countries grew tenfold, approximately from USD 18 billion to USD 180 billion. As of 2011, there are 42 free trade agreements registered which cover 237 bilateral relationships and approximately 89% of the region’s trade volume. This scenario provides outstanding opportunities to deepen the regional integration at the level of SMEs, which account for slightly more than 10% of intraregional trade, and yet have vast importance to the region’s economy (they represent more than 90% of the region’s companies and more than 50% of total employment). In this context, the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) has made it an institutional priority to strengthen the international investment and commercial ties of SMEs in the region.

In addition, Internet usage in Latin America and the Caribbean grew nearly 891% in the past decade. It was the region that grew the most in the world in internet usage in 2012-2013 (at 12%) far outpacing the second region, Asia-Pacific (7%).


The team’s mission:

Based on the above, in March 2014 the IDB launched ConnectAmericas (CA) (www.connectamericas.com) the first social business network of the Americas. It is a free online platform designed to help small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) carry out more and better international trade and investment transactions. It was launched in March 2014 and currently has over 270,000 businesspeople from over 120 countries registered on the platform, and over 2 million users from 200 countries have accessed its content.

CA allows users to:

  • Publish or apply to purchasing announcements from companies and government entities.
  • Find clients, suppliers, or partners, applying filter (sector, country, verification status) to a database of registered companies.
  • Discover business support services in their countries.
  • Sign up for business events in their countries and the rest of the world.
  • Apply to receive financing from banks in the region.
  • Strengthen their skills through articles, videos, and free online courses.

CA was developed and promoted by the IDB with support from its anchor partners (Google, DHL, Facebook, SeaLand, and Mastercard), and over 300 business support organizations within and beyond LAC. The CA anchor partners are world leaders in aspects that are critical to the development and promotion of the platform.


What you will do:

The objectives of the internship are:

  • To support ConnectAmericas (CA) daily operations and activities. This involves supporting the technology, business development, marketing, events, and data analytics teams.
  • To allow the intern to design, implement, and evaluate its own pilot or “mini-project” for CA. The scope of work will be agreed upon with CA management to ensure alignment with the CA’s objectives for 2021.

The main activities to perform are:

  • Identify and engage new business and knowledge partners for CA and support the implementation of working plans agreed with existing business and knowledge partners, such as Google, DHL, MasterCard, SeaLand, Facebook.
  • Prepare marketing, editorial, and other materials to be disseminated through the CA platform, its social media accounts, email marketing, and other dissemination channels.
  • Support the production of written and audiovisual content in e-commerce, foreign trade, and other topics relevant to the CA audience.
  • Support CA activities such as research, data gathering and processing, and information dissemination (possible topics include trade facilitation, single windows for foreign trade or investment, digital modernization of customs agencies, port communities’ systems, among others).

Deliverables and Payments timeline:

Deliverable 1: Two new Corporate or Knowledge Partner added to CA (includes scope of work definition, and agreed on work plan)

Deliverable 2: Five marketing materials produced (includes dissemination strategy)

Deliverable 3: Ten (10) pieces of content for SMEs produced (can be written, audio, or audiovisual)

Deliverable 4: Three (3) research briefings as a request by CA management

The payment schedule will be as follows: 25% on June 30, 25% on July 15, 25% on July 30, and 25% on August 13, 2021.

What you will need:

  • Education: Active graduate student (Master or PhD. program) or recent graduate from a graduate-level program (maximum of 1 year after graduation date) in a bachelor's degree in international commerce, computer science, data analytics, international relations, marketing, business administration, or similar in an accredited university.
  • Experience: Minimum two years of experience in program management or management support, online marketing, graphic design, MSME support, or applied research.
  • Languages: Be proficient in English and preferably with a working knowledge of one of the Bank’s additional official languages (e.g., Spanish, Portuguese, or French).
  • Soft Skills: Self-management, flexibility, dependability, relationship building, results-driven, with strong communication skills.
  • Technical skills: MS Office, Graphic design.

Remote Internship under PEC modality Requirements:

To be part of our Remote Internship you will need to comply with all the following requirements:

  • Be a national of an IDB member country.
  • Be minimum 23 years of age as of the starting date of the remote summer internship.
  • Be an active graduate student (Master or PhD. program) or recent graduate from a graduate-level program (maximum of 1 year after graduation date) in an accredited University.
  • For active graduate students, submit academic transcripts as an attachment to the application, demonstrating a minimum of 50% of coursework completion and issued within the last 3 months.
  • For recent graduates, submit a valid certificate with a graduation date no older than June 17, 2020, as an attachment to the application.
  • Not be former staff member, Complementary Workforce (“CW”), contractors for the Corporation or the Bank or have previously provided services to the Corporation or the Bank through a contractor or under any other consultant modality.
  • Not have family members (up to the fourth degree of consanguinity and second degree of affinity, including spouse) working at the IDB or IDB Invest.
  • Have access to an Internet connection.

Candidates with more than 3 applications in the 2021 Remote Summer Internship Program for IDB, IDB Lab, and IDB Invest will be automatically disqualified.

position: 2021 IDB Remote Summer Internship Program | Transport Division (INE/TSP)
description:
2021 IDB Remote Summer Internship Program | Transport Division (INE/TSP)


Background of this search:

The Transport Division (INE/TSP) of the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB) is looking for an active graduate student (Master or Ph.D.) or recent graduate (from the graduate-level program), with advanced research and data analytics skills and passion for applied technologies to improve transport services, to be hired as a Remote Summer Intern under Products and External Services Consultant (PEC) modality. Working with us you will be surrounded by a diverse group of people who have years of experience in all types of development fields, including transport, finance, health, gender, and diversity, and much more.


The team’s mission:

At the Inter-American Development Bank (IDB), we are devoted to improving lives. Since 1959, we have been a leading source of long-term financing for economic, social, and institutional development in Latin America and the Caribbean. We do more than lending though. We partner with our 48-member countries to provide Latin America and the Caribbean with cutting-edge research about relevant development issues, policy advice to inform their decisions, and technical assistance to improve on the planning and execution of projects. For this, we need people who not only have the right skills but also are passionate about improving lives.

The IDB's Transport Division (INE/TSP) supports the development of transport infrastructure (roads, ports, airports, railways, etc.) and its associated services in the Bank’s member countries. The IDB envisions transport services as a means towards a more inclusive region and to promote sustainable development. The knowledge strategy of the Division focuses on five strategic areas: Urban Transport, Mega Projects, Freight Logistics, Road Safety, and Intelligent Transport Systems (ITS). In addition, it also addresses four cross-cutting major challenges: Gender Equality, Sustainable Transport, Nearshoring, and Regional Integration, and Impact Evaluation. Furthermore, the division is actively promoting innovation in project planning, preparation, and/or operation of transport projects. From our perspective, innovation in transport can be understood as creating a differential factor (value-added) in every stage of a project life cycle: planning, preparation, execution, implementation, and operation; while bearing in mind that innovation goes beyond the incorporation of technology, and it is also related with developing and using new financing instruments, incorporating new theories to analyze and understand behavioral changes, and new regulation schemes; which allows to operate and deliver inclusive and efficient transport services. These topics are particularly important for the post-COVID economic recovery, as the transport sector is a key driver for employment and an enabler of nearshoring opportunities.


What you will do: The main objective of this internship is to advance the applied knowledge agenda of the Transport Division regarding crosscutting areas such as gender equality and climate change, as well as supporting operations-related activities. The selected candidate will perform the following activities:

  • Perform research tasks such as draft academic papers and/or knowledge products
  • Perform high-quality sector analysis on topics related to the Bank’s priorities (i.e. gender equality and diversity, poverty, economic productivity, nearshoring, climate change, among others). Those analyses might include statistical modeling, data mining, GIS analysis, among others.
  • Actively participate in the implementation of transport prototypes using machine learning applications in the different stages of transport projects, working in the design and management of systems for collecting, accessing, processing, and analyzing datasets including surveys, remote sensing, ground sensor, and vehicle-mounted sensors.
  • Perform qualitative and quantitative analyses of current and historical data to identify patterns, trends, and issues relevant to transport projects.
  • Accelerate and improve the appropriation of studies carried out by the division regarding the strategic areas and cross-cutting challenges. The latter includes extracting results, main findings and conclusions to be incorporated in publications and other knowledge products, blogs, podcasts, etc.

Deliverables and Payments timeline: The selected candidate will deliver the following products:

Deliverable 1: Literature review report

Deliverable 2: Progress report of the research performed

Deliverable 3: First draft of an academic paper that will be submitted to the Transport Research Board (TRB) 2022 Annual Meeting

Deliverable 4: Communications materials (Powerpoint presentation, booklets, 1 short blog post written in collaboration with the team)

The payment schedule will be as follows: 25% on June 30, 25% on July 15, 25% on July 30, and 25% on August 13, 2021.

What you will need:

  • Education: Active graduate student (Master or PhD. program) or recent graduate from a graduate-level program (maximum of 1 year after graduation date) in areas of transport and urban economics, international trade, data analytics, and a bachelor’s degree in economics, international development, artificial intelligence, computer science or technology, in an accredited university.
  • Experience: Minimum two years of experience in conducting econometric analysis, providing statistical and economical support, preparing background analysis (literature review), and data collecting (drafting survey questionnaires).
  • Languages: Be proficient in English or Spanish with a working knowledge of one of the Bank’s additional official languages (e.g., Portuguese).
  • Soft Skills: Self-management, flexibility, dependability, relationship building, results-driven, with strong communication skills. Strong ability to quickly absorb and process large quantities of complex information and produce concise analyses of the issues at hand. Ability to write clear and precise analytical documents and to adapt communication styles to different audiences.
  • Technical skills: Strong technical and analytical skills, with a background in statistics or econometrics modeling, an understanding and aptitude for development economics analysis, excellent academic background, and multidisciplinary-oriented. In-depth knowledge and working experience of R and preferably Python. Knowledge of GIS, remote sensing, and spatial statistics preferred. Programming Skills and working experience with large datasets such as Household Surveys and/or economic census.

Remote Internship under PEC modality Requirements:

To be part of our Remote Internship you will need to comply with all the following requirements:

  • Be a national of an IDB member country.
  • Be minimum 23 years of age as of the starting date of the remote summer internship.
  • Be an active graduate student (Master or PhD. program) or recent graduate from a graduate-level program (maximum of 1 year after graduation date) in an accredited University.
  • For active graduate students, submit academic transcripts as an attachment to the application, demonstrating a minimum of 50% of coursework completion and issued within the last 3 months.
  • For recent graduates, submit a valid certificate with a graduation date no older than June 17, 2020, as an attachment to the application.
  • Not be former staff member, Complementary Workforce (“CW”), contractors for the Corporation or the Bank or have previously provided services to the Corporation or the Bank through a contractor or under any other contractual modality.
  • Not have family members (up to the fourth degree of consanguinity and second degree of affinity, including spouse) working at the IDB or IDB Invest.
  • Have access to an Internet connection.

Candidates with more than 3 applications in the 2021 Remote Summer Internship Program for IDB, IDB Lab, and IDB Invest will be automatically disqualified.

UNS Energy Corporation, headquartered in Tucson, Arizona, is a subsidiary of Fortis Inc., the largest investor-owned electric and gas distribution utility in Canada. UNS Energy Corporation’s public utility subsidiaries, Tucson Electric Power Company, UNS Electric, Inc. and UNS Gas, Inc., provide electric and gas service to customers in southern and northern Arizona. For more information about UNS Energy Corporation, visit http://www.uns.com.

Tucson Electric Power provides safe, reliable electric service to approximately 414,000 customers in Southern Arizona. Although our company has been in business for more than 120 years, we continue to look for innovative ways of providing value, comfort, convenience and security to our customers every day. We’re evaluating cutting-edge energy technologies, reshaping our energy portfolio and expanding our renewable power and energy-efficiency programs. While our line of work can be challenging, it can also be rewarding. Our team of dedicated professionals values engagement, enthusiasm, innovation and collaboration.

Tucson Electric Power, one of Arizona’s leading utility companies, seeks an individual for the position of Client Services & Support Student Intern in the Information Technology department. We are looking for an energetic addition to our team to assist The Help Desk and Client Services groups.

The Help Desk Technician’s role is to ensure proper computer operation so that end users can accomplish business tasks. This includes receiving, prioritizing, documenting, and actively resolving end user help requests.

The Client Services team consists of Client Liaisons and Asset Management. Client Services handles Service Requests from beginning to end. Client Liaisons work with clients to ensure they have the proper hardware and software for their role. Asset Managers handle hardware and software asset management, procurement of assets, budgetary items for IS, etc.

Position-Related Responsibilities

  • Field incoming help requests from end users via both telephone Voicemails and e-mail in a courteous manner.
  • Document all pertinent end user identification information, including name, department, contact information, and nature of problem or issue.
  • Build rapport and elicit problem details from help desk customers.
  • Prioritize and schedule problems. Escalate problems (when required) to the appropriately experienced technician.
  • Verify hardware assets are assigned to clients.
  • Assist with reclaimed hardware requests to ensure hardware is returned properly.
  • Asset cleanup within ServiceNow.
  • Assist with inventory, confirming assets assigned to clients.
  • Add software models to ServiceNow.
  • Document Roles submitted by Supervisors and assist with scheduling Supervisor meetings.
  • Assist with software installation requests.

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

  • High school diploma or GED.
  • Effective written and oral communication skills are required plus a willingness to learn in a rapidly changing environment.
  • Demonstrated ability to work both independently and as part of a team.

Qualifications

  • Be pursuing a degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Mathematics or related discipline with an expected graduation date of 2022 or later
  • Be able to work a minimum of 20 hours per week during regular business hours; up to 40 hours a week may be available during the summer and school breaks
  • Have a high level of interpersonal skills and the ability to protect highly sensitive and confidential information; Must be able to meet regular deadlines
  • Demonstrate effective verbal and written communication skills
  • Possess functional knowledge of Microsoft Office products

Requirements

  • Must be able to work a minimum of 20 hours per week during regular business hours; and up to 40 hours a week during the summer and school breaks
  • Student Interns must be enrolled in a specified degree program and maintain the required hours for full-time student status, good academic standing at their college or university, as defined by the college or university and the GPA required for graduation by their college or university. Failure to maintain full-time status, good academic standing and/or the requisite GPA will result in student being deemed ineligible for participation in the program.
  • Student Interns are employed on a temporary basis and are generally not eligible for some benefits; including holiday pay.
  • Scheduling of work hours and assignments should be made taking into consideration that Student Interns are students first and employees second.

Donaldson is committed to solving the world’ s most complex filtration challenges. Employing innovation and breakthrough solutions, we are advancing filtration for a cleaner world. We look for the best people to help us succeed, offering opportunities to learn, effect change, and make meaningful contributions at work and in our communities. This is a place where you can make a world of difference.


At Donaldson, we advance filtration for a cleaner world. Our summer internships provide ambitious undergraduates the chance to gain real world experience in their field of study. We provide challenging, professional experience with a global corporation, where you learn from and work alongside Donaldson employees. Internships take place at our global headquarters in Bloomington, MN, over a 12 week period.

Perform IT PLM help desk responsibilities

  • Resolve Incidents

  • Review and update IT knowledge articles

PLM Application testing and deployment

  • Test new business functionality
  • Update and test business workflow processes
  • Test SCCM package deployment
  • Review application enhancements and deploy to servers

Data migration

  • Assist in data migration of CAD models into Teamcenter

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Strong preference toward Juniors or Seniors who are computer science majors, interested in CAD engineering or CAD engineering majors, interested in computer science. (Majors may include, but are not limited to: Engineering CAD Technology or IT Support Specialist, Computer Aided Design (CAD) Drafting Technologies, Information System Management, Software Development, Computer Science or Computer Information Science)
  • Motivated to learn complex applications including Teamcenter and CAD applications

Come make a World of Difference!

Role: Business Development Intern (MBA Only)

Location: Remote

For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,500 companies and 100 Million threats detected a day.

Business Development Team

The Business Development team develops partnerships and alliances that have an impact on the bottom line. We manage strategic, ecosystem and OEM partnerships. We are a small team of professionals that see partnership opportunities at the intersection of technology, business value and sales.

As a BD intern, you will work with the team to develop and manage technology partners. You will be exposed to a wide range of technologies and be able to understand and communicate how they work together to solve customer problems.

Responsibilities:

  • Work alongside experienced Bus Dev leaders to develop and nurture technology partner ecosystem
  • Work alongside experienced Bus Dev leaders to qualify and scope solutions that have a positive impact on driving business for partnership
  • Draft marketing content to showcase joint solutions
  • Apply Account based Marketing tools and tactics to identify and engage key stakeholders for developing new sell-with partnerships
  • Develop framework for getting inputs from partners and internal stakeholders on performance and improvements to tech partner program

Required Skill Sets:

  • Business Acumen – Understand the value of a technology partnership. Understand how business objectives align or compete. Be able to communicate succinctly on why a partnership matters.
  • Technology Acumen – Understand a wide variety of technologies and how they impact Zscaler and possible integration points.
  • Analytical – Be able to research a company or industry and present findings to reach a conclusion.
  • Strong writing and presentation skills – actively listens and communicates well.
  • Collaborative – must be easy to work with.
  • Organized – ability to prioritize and multi-task extensively.

Qualifications:

  • Be currently enrolled in a MBA program at an accredited University. Must be enrolled in a program for the duration of the internship.
  • Bachelors Degree required in Computer Science or a related engineering discipline.
  • Prior work experience in drafting marketing content preferred.

What You Can Expect From Us:

  • An environment where you will be working on developing solutions with cutting edge technologies to disrupt the market incumbents
  • Mentored by the best talent in the industry to learn the skills for developing a technology partner ecosystem that not only solves customer problems but also contributes to pipeline
  • Learn how to execute an Account Based Marketing campaign, from start to finish.
  • A fun, passionate and collaborative workplace
  • The pace and excitement of working for a hyper growth Silicon Valley Unicorn

Why Zscaler?

People who excel at Zscaler are smart, motivated and share our values. Ask yourself: Do you want to team with the best talent in the industry? Do you want to work on disruptive technology? Do you thrive in a fluid work environment? Do you appreciate a company culture that enables individual and group success and celebrates achievement? If you said yes, we’d love to talk to you about joining our award-winning team.

Learn more at zscaler.com or follow us on Twitter @zscaler. Additional information about Zscaler (NASDAQ : ZS ) is available at http://www.zscaler.com. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.

description:
2021 IDB Remote Summer Internship Program | The Pension Administration Unit VPF/SRP

The Pension Administration Unit of the Executive Secretariat of the Staff Retirement Plans is looking for an active graduate student (Master or Ph.D.) or recent graduate (graduate-level program) with a computer science and data analytic academic background to be hired as a Remote Summer Intern under Products and External Services Consultant (PEC) modality.


The team’s mission: The mission of the Pension Administration Team (SRA) is to provide a high-quality service to more than 5,000 Plans’ participants including active, retired, and beneficiaries in accordance with the Plans’ provisions. To accomplish its mission, SRA team members: i) provide information to individual participants regarding retirement provisions; ii) process retirement applications and payments; iii) oversee the calculation and implementation of annual cost-of-living adjustments in all the Plans’ countries; v) support the production of actuarial valuations through gathering and auditing of the Plans’ data; v) support oversight committees in handling unusual benefit administration issues and the revision of the Plans’ regulations as needed; vi) conduct semi-annual presentations at headquarters for soon-to-retire participants and their partners; vii) travel to Country Offices (COF) on a periodic basis to present Plan benefits to active and retired participants of those COFs; viii) work with the retirement plan offices of comparator international organizations in the transfer of benefits subject to established agreements, and with the Bank’s Legal Department and comparator international organizations to establish new benefit transfer agreements; ix) work with the IDB Group’s Human Resources and Finance departments to ensure that the retirement plan PAS information reconciles with the Bank’s SAP system; x) work with the Bank’s IT department to support the information of active staff in the Employee Self Service system and of retired participants in the Retiree Self Service system; and xi) administer retiree life insurance payments.

What you will do:

The purpose of this consultancy is to produce a report on the evolution of the main demographic variables of the retirement plans from their creation to the present.

  • First activity: In coordination with the Pension Administration Team, define scope of the study, source of information, the timetable for its preparation, and format to deliver the results.
  • Second activity: Carryout a rigorous intertemporal analysis of demographic variables of the retirement plans to identify trends, correlations, and implications for the plans.
  • Third activity: Submit and present a first draft of the report for internal discussion.
  • Fourth activity Submit and present the final report.

Deliverables and Payments timeline:

Deliverable 1: Inventory of demographic variables to be included in the study, an indicative list of questions that will be intended to answer with the study, and a timetable for its preparation.

Deliverable 2: Progress report of the research perform

Deliverable 3: Final report from findings

Deliverable 4: Communications materials (Powerpoint presentation, internal presentation, final report)

The payment schedule will be as follows: 25% on June 30, 25% on July 15, 25% on July 30, and 25% on August 13, 2021.

What you will need:

  • Education: Active graduate student (Master or PhD. program) or recent graduate from a graduate-level program (maximum of 1 year after graduation date) in computer science and data analytic academic background in an accredited university.
  • Experience: Minimum two years of experience in areas relevant for this assignment, such as computer science, data analytic, demography, and HR management.
  • Languages: Be proficient in English. Knowledge of Spanish is a plus.
  • Soft Skills: Self-management, flexibility, dependability, relationship building, results-driven, with strong communication skills.
  • Technical skills: Strong knowledge of data science skills, tools, and concepts. Ability to collect and utilize sets of data to find patterns through visualization and other mining techniques. Extensive exposure to database systems, data mining tools, and data visualization tools. Skill to harness the power of data and tell its story in a compelling way for a vast audience.

Remote Internship under PEC modality Requirements:

To be part of our Remote Internship you will need to comply with all the following requirements:

  • Be a national of an IDB member country.
  • Be minimum 23 years of age as of the starting date of the remote summer internship.
  • Be an active graduate student (Master or PhD. program) or recent graduate from a graduate-level program (maximum of 1 year after graduation date) in an accredited University.
  • For active graduate students, submit academic transcripts as an attachment to the application, demonstrating a minimum of 50% of coursework completion and issued within the last 3 months.
  • For recent graduates, submit a valid certificate with a graduation date no older than June 17, 2020, as an attachment to the application.
  • Not be former staff member, Complementary Workforce (“CW”), contractors for the Corporation or the Bank or have previously provided services to the Corporation or the Bank through a contractor or under any other contractual modality.
  • Not have family members (up to the fourth degree of consanguinity and second degree of affinity, including spouse) working at the IDB or IDB Invest.

Tethers Unlimited, Inc. is a 65-person aerospace production and R&D company located in Bothell, WA. Founded in 1994, we're nimble, resourceful and fun, and we work on a variety of cool cutting-edge projects in the space industry.

MAKING A POSITIVE IMPACT AT TETHERS UNLIMITED, INC (TUI): Build technology that will go to space! Our company innovates technology to make a wide array of products and projects, everything from software defined radios, Hydros water-based thrusters, antenna pointing gimbals and many others to Connect the Universe. At Tethers we are still a small enough company that you will have a huge impact, yet large enough to provide you the resources needed to grow and be effective. Much larger companies haven’t flown anywhere near the number of products into space that we have. So, if you want to make your mark and be part of the next mission, now is the time to apply.

SUMMARY/OBJECTIVE: As an Aerospace Systems Engineer Intern, you will contribute to development of cutting-edge spacecraft payload and subsystem technologies. Topics include Hydros water electrolysis propulsion, COBRA 3DoF gimbal mechanism, and On-Orbit Servicing, Assembly and Manufacturing (OSAM) technologies.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Junior or Senior year student pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree or student working on Advanced Degree in Aerospace Engineering, Mechatronics, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or other relevant engineering discipline required.

Coursework or project experience in one or more of the following:

  • Orbital mechanics and mission design
  • Thermal modeling and heat transfer
  • Brushless motor driver development
  • Computer Vision for embedded systems

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: This position has no supervisory responsibilities.

PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, use hands, and reach with hands and arms. Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine, and printer. May encounter prolonged periods of sitting. Intermittent physical activity including bending, reaching, pushing, pulling, or lifting up to 40 lbs.

EXPECTED HOURS OF WORK: This is a full-time position requiring a minimum of 40 hours per week.

TRAVEL: No travel is expected for this position (0%).

WORK AUTHORIZATION/SECURITY CLEARANCE ITAR Requirements: This position requires special security screenings to conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, which may include the ability to obtain a U.S. Security Clearance. The U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship exclusively.

OTHER DUTIES: Please note that this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

  • Exciting opportunities to make products that go into space, define the future of business in space.
  • We seek new ideas and fresh perspectives, innovation. Teamwork and collaboration are valued.
  • The team members that work here are awesome!

  • Smart, engaged co-workers who value and support each other’s growth

SUMMER 2021 INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITY

AMERICAN CIVIL LIBERTIES UNION

Please Note: ALL ACLU SUMMER INTERNSHIPS ARE REMOTE

ANALYTICS, NY

The Analytics Team of the National ACLU Digital, Tech & Analytics Department has openings for graduate or undergraduate internships in New York, NY.

For 100 years, the ACLU has been our nation's guardian of liberty, working in courts, legislatures, and communities to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties guaranteed by the Constitution and laws of the United States. Whether it's ending mass incarceration, achieving full equality for the LGBT community, advancing racial justice, establishing new privacy protections for our digital age, or preserving the right to vote or the right to have an abortion, the ACLU takes up the toughest civil liberties and civil rights cases and issues to defend all people from government abuse and overreach. With nearly two million members, activists, and supporters, the ACLU is a nationwide organization that fights tirelessly in all 50 states, Puerto Rico, and Washington, D.C., for the principle that every individual's rights must be protected equally under the law, regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, and record of arrest or conviction.

INTERNSHIP OVERVIEW

Our interns will help our Analytics team to drive quantitative analyses that will transform the way the nationwide organization achieves its mission. This includes creating analyses and visualizations to support strategic and operational decision making across advocacy, constituent engagement, and fundraising; setting up data pipelines and workflows for the infrastructure side of our team, as well as quantitative research to support legal and program work. Interns will also have opportunities to work with experienced data scientists and develop skills building models, developing visualizations, and conducting experiments and statistical tests, both in a business context and on ACLU priority issues.

  • Time Commitment: The internship requires a full-time commitment of 35 hours per week.
  • Internship Duration: Internships are a 10-week period (full-time). Summer interns are expected to start May 24 or June 1, 2021.
  • Stipend: A stipend is available for those students who do not receive course credit. Students who receive outside funding are eligible for a partial stipend to bring their total summer funding up to the level of ACLU's stipend amount for that term, if applicable. Arrangements can be made with educational institutions for work/study or course credit.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Interns will have the opportunity to gain valuable experience by working alongside the Analytics team on the following:
  • Helping to build analytical tools, including dashboards for internal partners
  • Conducting quantitative analyses
  • Collecting, cleaning, and joining datasets from diverse sources
  • Interpreting the results of analyses for non-technical audiences
  • Presenting work internally and to stakeholders on other teams
  • Other duties as assigned

EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS

The internship is open to undergraduate or graduate students in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Data Science, Mathematics, Computer Science) or with significant quantitative coursework (e.g., Statistics, Computer Programming, Linear Algebra). Interns should possess the following:
  • Familiarity with Python, R, SQL, or similar analytics and programming language
  • Excellent problem-solving skills Excellent organizational and communication skills
  • Experience with data collection and cleaning a plus
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, and Excel a plus
  • Familiarity with Looker, Tableau, or other visualization tools a plus
  • Commitment to work collaboratively and respectfully toward resolving obstacles and/or conflict
  • A commitment to civil liberties, civil rights, and social justice
  • Commitment to the mission of the ACLU

This posting provides a general but not comprehensive list of the opportunities of the internship. It does not represent a contract of employment. The ACLU reserves the right to change the posting at any time without advance notice.

The ACLU is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability and need assistance applying online, please e-mail benefits.hrdept@aclu.org. If you are selected for an interview, you will receive additional information regarding how to request an accommodation for the interview process.

Job Description:

Wind River believes that some things are so important they simply cannot fail. That is why we exist. Wind River software has been running the computing systems of the most important critical infrastructure that demand the highest standards for safety, security, performance, and reliability. Found in more than 2 billion devices, Wind River is pioneering edge compute cloud technologies to accelerate the evolution from automated devices to autonomous systems. We have a spot for you!

We're looking for a Spring/Summer Interns (approximately: April – September) to join the Core OS development team of Wind River's flagship VxWorks Operating System. This candidate will focus on Wind River Studio a cloud-based environment for build and validation pipelines used for kernel related features. Candidates may also contribute to VxWorks kernel features. This is a 40-hour per week paid internship. Qualified candidates must be an enrolled student or recent college graduate looking to gain work experience.

What you will have an opportunity to work on:

The main responsibilities of this position will be to contribute to the development, maintenance, enhancement of features and tests related to the kernel technologies and Wind River Cloud solutions. The position will work with a variety of target platforms (PowerPC, Intel, ARM) on physical targets and simulators. You will be working closely with a talented group of OS, kernel, and architecture experts.

Requirements:

  • GPA of 3.0 or higher majoring in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent
  • Completing 3 years of study as of April 2021 or higher
  • Knowledge of Operating Systems or taken courses in Operating Systems is a plus
  • Cloud development using Docker / Jenkins / Kubernetes
  • Practical experience with at least the C language
  • Good debugging and problem-solving skills
  • Good written and oral communication skills
  • Assembly language is a plus
  • Knowledge of scripting languages such as Python, shell scripts etc. is also a plus

Information Technology Intern

TeleTracking, Technologies is looking for exceptional talent with great ideas, cutting edge skills, and a passion for technology and healthcare. We’re not your average IT shop, and this isn’t your average internship. In your 11 weeks with TeleTracking, you’ll have a voice in the room, be pushed and challenged, and play a critical role in innovative projects that are transforming healthcare technology. Ready to get started?

What’s in it for you?

A typical employee spends eight hours a day at work…we think you should spend that time doing something that you love-not just earning a paycheck. As a TeleTracking Intern, you will get to meet and interact with our senior leadership team and complete meaningful work. You will work on individual and group projects that you will present to not only the Senior Leadership Team, but all kinds of TeleTracking employees. You will have an assigned mentor that will be there for you and coach you through your time here at TeleTracking. You will learn that we work hard, but we play hard too. We invite you to participate in events, such as team-building, lots of good food and of course giving back to our community.

Here’s what you will do all summer!
  • Ensures the workability of all hardware and software for laptops, desktops, peripherals, copiers, printers, and fax machines which includes imaging, set-up and deployment.
  • Is dedicated to meeting the needs of our internal customers by providing technical assistance and support for incoming queries and issues related to computer systems, software, and hardware.
  • Maintains a log of hardware, software, systems and networking issues via the ticketing system while ensuring timely feedback to impacted end-users.
  • Tracks and maintains accurate inventory of all TeleTracking computing equipment (laptop, desktop and server) and software licenses.
  • Educates Tele’s staff on IT best practices and effective usage of corporate computer applications and systems.
  • Uses effective problem solving technics and methodologies to troubleshoots system issues and outages for critical internally-used enterprise systems including, but not limited to, Active Directory, DNS, Certificate infrastructure, print servers, Office 365, email, collaboration tools, network, and telephony.
  • Manages system lifecycle of critical internally used enterprise systems including setup, configuration, patching, upgrades, data protection, monitoring, and retirement.
  • Does what it takes which may mean providing after-hours and weekend support for critical, internally-used enterprise systems related to emergencies as well occasional weekend maintenance to resolve issues and get our systems and tools back to operating effectively.
  • Is a self-directed learner and shares learnings with others by building and managing an internal wiki with technical documentation and manuals.
Here’s what you need to get the work done:
  • Undergraduate or graduate student with one year or less left to graduate in Computer Science or Equivalent Field
  • Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher
  • An ability to think abstractly and work across different areas of the company
  • Strong communication and presentation skills
  • Availability to participate for the duration of the Internship Program full-time
  • Attention to detail is a must

Competitive Intelligence Internship

(Remote, NE)

Are you ready for a new challenge?

Celonis is the leader in business transformation software. Powered by its market-leading process mining core, the Celonis Execution Management System provides a set of instruments and applications, with a developer studio and platform capabilities for business executives and users. The Celonis EMS offerings help companies manage every facet of execution management from analytics, to strategy and planning, management, actions and automations. For Global 2000 companies, transforming to an intelligent enterprise has become a key strategic priority. Celonis disrupted what had previously been a manual, time-consuming and expensive consulting-driven approach to jump-start and operationalize change in transformation initiatives. Celonis has thousands of global customers including ABB, AstraZeneca, Bosch, Coca Cola, Citibank, Dell, GSK, John Deere, L'Oreal, Siemens, Uber, Vodafone and Whirlpool. All rely on Celonis technology to unlock their full execution capacity and drive change to business processes. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany and New York, New York, and has in total 15 offices worldwide. The company has grown 5,000% in 4 years and 300% in the past year. In 2019, Celonis reached a $2.5 billion valuation, after receiving a $290 million Series C funding round. Since opening its US headquarter in New York in September 2016 it has quickly added blue chip customers like Lockheed Martin, ExxonMobil, Honeywell, and Mars to its client roster. The US is the fastest growing region for Celonis and will soon exceed 50% of its total revenue, and therefore expanding US offices in New York, San Francisco, Raleigh, Ann Arbor, as well as Latin America.

As a Competitive Intelligence Intern within the Competitive Intelligence team, you will have the opportunity to help define and drive the go-to-market positioning and strategy for the Celonis Platform and Applications. You will be a member of the high-impact Competitive Intelligence team, defining market strategy for one of the world's fastest-growing software companies. You will be responsible for supporting the go-to-market teams in competitive deals, defining strategic positioning of the product, and working with the product teams to influence the roadmap.


Our Competitive Intelligence team is the key link between Product, Marketing, Sales, Customer Success, Partner Management, Development, and Executives.


Responsibilities:

  • Establish and maintain a thorough understanding of the enterprise software market including Process Mining, RPA, BPM, Low-code Automation, Enterprise AI, and Business Intelligence.
  • Know your products' competition and coach customer-facing teams on how to outmaneuver them.
  • Collaborate with and support the go-to-market teams in individual deals against competitors. This includes speaking with prospects to differentiate the Celonis platform.
  • Leverage market research and analysis on the enterprise software market to influence product strategy and roadmap.
  • Develop competitive positioning material against specific competitors and other categories of software.
  • Be the company expert on market intelligence, enabling the global Celonis organization on market landscape and positioning.
  • Establish and cultivate relationships with industry analysts, investors, domain experts and partners.
  • Conduct trend analysis and deal debriefs on competitive deals, reporting back to the executive team.
  • Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, and Partner teams to define go-to-market approach and drive execution in collaboration with the entire organization.

Requirements:

  • Pursuing an Undergraduate degree in Business administration, Data Science, Analytics, Computer Science or any relative degree
  • any experience with process automation or Artificial Intelligence software is a plus
  • Previous strategy & market research knowledge & exposure.
  • Strong public speaking, presentation, and communication skills
  • Intellectual curiosity with an innate desire to learn and master market dynamics, customer stories, and competitive advantage
  • Agile and team-oriented, ability to give and receive feedback, change tact, and collaborate with a team to achieve a goal
  • Ability to see the big picture and contribute to strategy development while also working in the details
  • Ability to work full-time 40hrs/week for 12 weeks starting June 7th 2021

Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Different makes us better

position: Summer 2021 Internship, Digital, Tech, & Analytics - Software Engineer
description:
SUMMER 2021 INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITY

AMERICAN CIVIL LIBERTIES UNION

Please Note: ALL ACLU SUMMER INTERNSHIPS ARE REMOTE

DIGITAL, TECH, & ANALYTICS - NY OFFICE

The Technology Team of the National ACLU Digital, Tech, & Analytics Department has openings for undergraduate or graduate interns in New York, NY.

For 100 years, the ACLU has been our nation's guardian of liberty, working in courts, legislatures, and communities to defend and preserve the individual rights and liberties guaranteed by the Constitution and laws of the United States. Whether it's ending mass incarceration, achieving full equality for the LGBT community, advancing racial justice, establishing new privacy protections for our digital age, or preserving the right to vote or the right to have an abortion, the ACLU takes up the toughest civil liberties and civil rights cases and issues to defend all people from government abuse and overreach. With nearly two million members, activists, and supporters, the ACLU is a nationwide organization that fights tirelessly in all 50 states, Puerto Rico, and Washington, D.C., for the principle that every individual's rights must be protected equally under the law, regardless of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, and record of arrest or conviction.

The tech team is a multidisciplinary department of product managers, designers, software engineers, and administrators working with stakeholder groups across the organization to build products that support the advocacy, fundraising, communications, and programmatic needs of the nationwide organization.

Our interns will join cross-functional teams and work alongside engineers at all levels to help build public-facing and internal products that support our efforts in education, fundraising, and political advocacy, as well as management and analysis of our donor data.

Our team welcomes and encourages applicants of all backgrounds and identities.

INTERNSHIP OVERVIEW

As part of the internship, interns will have the opportunity to cultivate their professional skills through presentations and feedback sessions, organizational talks, and employee resource groups. Help us design, develop, test, deploy, and iterate the software that supports our mission and objectives.

  • Time Commitment: The internship requires a full-time commitment of 35 hours per week.
  • Internship Duration: Internships are a 10-week period (full-time). Summer interns are expected to start May 24 or June 1, 2021.
  • Stipend: A stipend is available for those students who do not receive course credit. Students who receive outside funding are eligible for a partial stipend to bring their total summer funding up to the level of ACLU's stipend amount for that term, if applicable. Arrangements can be made with educational institutions for work/study or course credit.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Responsibilities may include, but are not limited to the following:

  • Develop and test web-based pages and user flows for www.aclu.org, such as our news articles, donation forms, petition pages, campaign tools, and other ACLU web-based applications
  • Research and prototype new software libraries, tools, and 3rd party integrations
  • Follow best practices for implementing clean code and writing automated tests; iterating solutions based on peer feedback and code reviews
  • Demonstrate an awareness and action in service of maintaining an inclusive team and work atmosphere
  • Working collaboratively and respectfully toward resolving obstacles and conflicts
  • Uphold the mission and objectives of the ACLU

EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS

This internship is open to students (including undergraduate, graduate, bootcamp, and self-taught) of computer science, human-computer interaction, or related fields, with previous hands-on software development experience through coursework and/or personal projects.

Interns should possess the following:

  • Hands-on experience with at least one common web programming language, such as JavaScript, PHP, Python, or Ruby
  • Experience with HTML and CSS; for candidates interested in front-end web development, knowledge of supporting tools such as jQuery, SASS, Vue.js, or React is nice to have but not required
  • Experience writing code that interacts with a REST API is nice to have but not required
  • A commitment to civil liberties, civil rights, and social justice.
  • Commitment to the mission of the ACLU

Applications will be considered on a rolling basis and accepted until the position is filled.


This posting provides a general but not comprehensive list of the opportunities of the internship. It does not represent a contract of employment. The ACLU reserves the right to change the posting at any time without advance notice.

The ACLU is committed to providing reasonable accommodation to individuals with disabilities. If you are a qualified individual with a disability and need assistance applying online, please e-mail benefits.hrdept@aclu.org. If you are selected for an interview, you will receive additional information regarding how to request an accommodation for the interview process.

description:
Hello, and thank you for your interest in our Summer Technology Teacher and Assistant Positions! Below is an overview of the program and positions as well as a few questions to help us determine if you are a good fit for our company.

***** APPLY ONLINE http://bit.ly/3e4ONvU ***************

************************
**JOB DESCRIPTION**
************************

You must be available for 8 weeks this summer from June 8 to August 7. Classes typically run Monday-Thursday with occasional Fridays, and you will need to be available from 8 am to 5 pm. Some classes run in only the morning or just the afternoon, and sometimes both.

As a Teacher or Assistant, you will be driving to your site, typically a school or community education building. You will typically be responsible for bringing 2-3 plastic bins of equipment per class, which you will then be set up in a classroom before students arrive. You will need vehicle to transport class equipment. Our headquarter location is in Roseville, Minnesota. You will need to go every 1 to 3 weeks to our headquarters for training and equipment pick up and drop off.

Rochester and St. Cloud teachers will only need to go twice in one summer

You will be delivering our curriculum to classes of up to 18 students. Teachers must be comfortable with managing up to 12 students alone. Grade level will vary between K-8th grades depending on the class.

************************
ABOUT PROGRAM:
************************
Tech Academy teaches week-long technology classes throughout the US. We offer classes in Minecraft, Movie Making, Video Game Design, Legos, and Robotics for students ages 6-14. We are seeking enthusiastic applicants for our Summer Camp Technology Teacher and Assistant positions.

Ideal applicants for Teacher positions are college students/graduates with experience with elementary-age children or licensed teachers.

Ideal applicants for Assistant positions are tech-savvy high school or college students, or those qualified for the Lead Teacher position looking for a more relaxed role in the classroom.

Many of our past employees were able to use position to satisfy an internship requirement from school.

************************
Training and Equipment:
************************
Before teaching or assisting, teachers must complete 12 hours of online training on basic camp management and leadership skills. You must also complete an in house 12-hour employee orientation.

The curriculum will be provided to each teacher for each class. You are required to go over the curriculum, and submit projects to us prior to teaching. We will available during business hours via phone and email to help you. You will be provided all of the equipment needed to teach a class each week.

************************
Pay:
************************
Teachers: $15-$20 an hour
Assistants $12-$16 an hour
Prep and training: $8.25 an hour

************************
Requirements:
************************
-College Student/Graduate majoring in Engineering, Computer Science, Graphic or Visual Arts, Video Game Design or Education
-Experience with Elementary age children
-Have a valid driver’s license
-You will be required to complete a local and national background check
-Be very comfortable with technology and using computers
-Your own reliable vehicle that can transport up to 4 large plastic totes
-Able to lift equipment totes weighing up to 40 pounds
-You must be very punctual and reliable. Students must always be supervised.
-You must be organized and efficient to run an effective class
-You must be self-confident, energetic, creative, and assertive enough to control a class of high energy elementary-age kids
-You need to be able to work independently and communicate via email and phone with us on a regular basis
Reliable access to the Internet and a cell phone.

Plusses:
Knowledge of Legos, Minecraft, or both Programming or Robotics experience of any kind

Responsibilities:
PPM is seeking a Data Analytics Intern!

Under direct supervision, the individual will be responsible for the development, customization, and support of analytics solutions to facilitate Intergraph PP&M business processes. The individual will be involved in all phases of the software development lifecycle. Responsibilities will include analytics, data solutions, integrations, and visualizations development. Technologies will include various big data technologies on the Microsoft Azure platform as well as other big data technologies such as PowerBI, Tableau, and SQL Server. Responsibilities will include development, customization, and support of a data analytics solution primarily using Microsoft cloud technologies and Tableau. The individual will be involved with telemetry collection, data lake storage, analytics and visualization. Because of the wide range of analytics consumers involved, this role will require good communication. The end goal will be to produce clear and compelling information to customers and internal stakeholders. The information will impact business performance improvements in the areas of product development and sales as well as other business functions. Therefore, the individual must possess the initiative to learn a broad set of enterprise systems technologies and patterns and how they apply to various business needs. The individual will work in an Agile environment using Scrum processes and XP development techniques. The individual will do regular demos of functionality to a product owner and end users. The individual will work within a cross-functional team to provide an optimum solution to complex problems. The individual will play a key role in implementing and maintaining these business system solutions.
Qualifications:
  • Candidate should be pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Computer Science, Mathematics or another related field.
  • Experience in business systems development, software development or another relevant technical field is required. Experience with SQL or similar data querying language is required. Experience with some big data and analytics technology is preferred. Experience with a data visualization tool such as Tableau is preferred. Experience with a source control management solution is preferred.
  • The individual must be able to work under direct supervision and possess strong communication skills. The individual must display strong critical thinking skills. The individual must display the ability to understand business needs and find valuable solutions to meet those needs. The individual must be a team player and will be required to work with a team of cross-functional developers.
  • Adherence to coding standards, software configuration management, and DevOps management processes including change management, source control, and release management is required. Good documentation skills are expected. Originality, ingenuity, independent judgment and a reasonable degree of self-direction and decision-making are expected.
